description: As it is on the North Pier, rooms on three sides have sea views, some rooms at the back can be noisy from the pubs below.
name: Columba Hotel

reviews.author: Suzanne White
reviews.content: This inn was wonderful, beautiful and spacious rooms and bathroom. Our room had a great view of the harbor, I really cannot say enough good things. The breakfast had a large selection of fresh fruit, bagels and cereal with coffee, tea and hot chocolate available 24 hours a day. Ok the negative was, in Fells Point there are really only pubs and ice cream shops you must walk (20--25 minutes) or water taxi to the inner harbor for restaurants. But then you can return to the Inn and escape.

reviews.author: Zita Ward
reviews.content: We have four children and stayed in two rooms next to one another during the gap between Christmas and New Years Day. Extremely happy with the rooms; very comfortable beds, towels and very much liked the breakfast buffet.

reviews.author: Charity Goyette
reviews.content: I recently extended a business trip a few extra days, decided to avoid the chain hotels, and made reservations at Henderson’s Wharf Inn. It’s the smartest thing I’ve done in a long time! The inn is ideally situated in Fell’s Point, within walking distance to Baltimore’s Inner Harbor. The inn’s entrance, lobby, and rooms are nicely decorated and very comfortable. The inn provides luxurious robes, a complimentary bottle of wine, and a well-stocked snack and beverage bar. The Inn also provides complimentary breakfast, which is enough to get you going in the mornings. You can enjoy your breakfast, weather permitting, in their courtyard garden. It’s worth noting that the inn’s guest rooms are on the first floor with either marina or garden views. The floors above are residences, which add to the appeal. You never quite feel like a tourist, and instead feel quite at home. The cobblestone streets, shops, pubs (lots of them), cafés and restaurants of Fell’s Point might keep you busy and away from the Inner Harbor. However, if you do remember to visit the harbor, you're within walking distance. The walk will take you along the water’s edge, or you can just as easily take the water-taxis that will take you back and forth all day long for one fare. Please try the taxis at nights; the city lights are wonderful at night! I’ll be returning again, and will only consider staying at Henderson’s Wharf Inn!

title: Oban

description: Campground with a local pub nearby.
name: Station House Caravan Park

reviews.author: Caesar Rempel
reviews.content: We have stayed here several times, at least once on the concierge level. This time we just had a standard room, typical Marriott, comfy beds, nicely furnished, granite countertops, single serving coffee/tea maker, mini frig, about average size for a hotel in the heart of the city. The location cannot be beat - the T is right outside, as is the harbor, the aquarium, the (very good) Legal Seafood restaurant and, of course, Quincy Market and the North End. Even the tour buses and harbor tour boats are right there. Also positive - great view of harbor from our room, a new lobby with a very welcoming bar/restaurant, with tv screens everywhere including some for your private viewing in the booths. A few negatives - no newspaper delivered to the door, USA Today and WSJ are available in lobby but no local newspapers. Would be nice to have the Boston Globe to check out local events and get a feel for the city. For the first time, our stay here was very noisy. We are silver Rewards members with standing request for quiet room, which has always been honored in the past. Our room was on the fifth floor, but it fronted on the atrium, right over the bar/lounge/restaurant. Not sure if they had a convention meeting there or just a large crowd, but it was noisy well into the night. I would definitely ask for a room away from the atrium if we return, and stay elsewhere if they couldn't guarentee it. Also, they charge for internet use, even in the lobby and the business center. They do have computers in the business center for free use, but center is not very private (no door, and it's open to the lobby). I also found that I could not navigate on their computers as I would on my laptop, there seemed to be some limitations -- and I was not trying to access any racy sites!! Just gmail, trip advisor, and some event listings. The towels were also extremely thin, not at all up to the standard that the price of the room would suggest. The room lacked a magnifying mirror, which is surprising with all the business people (incl women) who stay there. Altho the new lobby was nice, we did miss the seating near the Starbucks downstairs (the ground floor has just Starbucks, registration & lobby are up a flight). Before the renovations there was seating for Starbucks so you could have breakfast there or relax with coffee and pastry in afternoon. Now it is "to go" only, so you'd have to bring your coffee and treats back to the room or eat/drink on the go. Wondering if they eliminated seating to encourage guests to have breakfast in their newly renovated restaurant??

reviews.author: Travon Little
reviews.content: I have been to this location before children a number of times. However, did not realize how unsafe the inner balcony design was until my 22 months old son tried to climb. We almost lost him, I just turned around for 2 seconds to open the hotel door when I saw him half way up on the balcony. There is no safety measure built under, so it's a straight drop to a few floor down. It was a scary experience. Tried to write and talk to someone in the hotel regarding this matter but no one seemed to notice or care. Also, there were a lot of drunken people being very loud outside the corridor in the middle of the night.

reviews.author: Louvenia Harber
reviews.content: We had a wonderful time staying at this Marriott. We stay in Boston quite often, but usually dont stay right down on the water. We had the kids and thought this would be fun. This hotel is wonderful, right across the street from teh aquariam, shopping, and food vendors. Parking was also very, very easy as they will valet everything. It was surprisingly easy to get to, but we knew how to avoid the traffic. We did see some of the notes regarding the construction, but to be honest, we never heard a thing. Looking forward to going back

reviews.author: Reginald Goodwin Jr.
reviews.content: We took the kids to Boston for a sightseeing weekend to kick off summer break. I debated whether to reserve two rooms or pile into one room. We have one pre-teen and two teenagers. I ended up reserving one room and requesting a roll away. We arrived very late on our arrival day (nearly midnight) and were relieved the roll away was already in our room. The hotel was under renovation, so felt compartmentalized and rather plain, but the cleaning staff added her own sense of sparkle to our stay which dramatically improved our opinion of the hotel. (Smiles, fresh towels, spotless room, etc...) The location was picturesque and easy. You can hop on the T literally right outside the door and there were dining options within steps of the hotel. One evening, our tired kids grabbed dinner across the street at Quincy Market and headed back to the hotel while my husband and I had a leisurely dinner at Legal Seafoods, also across the street. We did not spend a lot of time at the hotel, but found it convenient and comfortable for our stay. Positives: location, comfortable beds, excellent staff. Negatives: a little noisy.

title: Offa's Dyke Path

description: Has 40 pitches and 4 caravan sites.
name: Llyn Rhys Campsite

reviews.author: Mrs. Dovie Harber
reviews.content: Seeking a convenient location to Quincy Market and activities, we stayed here on our last night of vacation. The hotel is under construction but they had someone there to guide you where to go at all times. We were able to check in very early. Unfortunately the room we were given was right above the outdoor bar area which was very loud on a Saturday night. We called the front desk around midnight to see how late the bar would be hopping and when we got our bill in the morning, they had comped us half the cost! We were very impressed with the management. The rooms are very comfortable and clean. But the location is the best thing about this hotel (besides the Starbucks in the lobby).

reviews.author: Olga Wunsch
reviews.content: When travelling we usually stay in one of the Marriott family hotels with good experience. However, we found the experience at Marriott Long Wharf below Marriott standards. At time of booking (early June) it mentioned construction was to be finished by mid May 2011. Big surprise to find out at checking in that construction was far from over. First morning 7:10 AM we woke up at the sound of heavy construction machinery... Unacceptable! We were moved to another section of the hotel which was far less noisy, but ..... why put guests in rooms so close to the construction in the first place when other rooms are available??? Besides the construction sounds, the hotel is built in such a manner that the noise from public area below, lobby and/or events areas cannot be blocked from most rooms. That means when in your room you will certainly hear kids running around and doors being shut(throughout the night!). We were 'forced' to enjoy the music of a wedding taking place in the events area and sounds of breakfast taking place in that same area since the restaurant was temporarily under construction. Finally, service is courteous but certainly not friendly or warm. Rooms are spacious, neat and housekeeping is good. Marriott: Yes! Boston Marriott Longwharf: No!!

reviews.author: Keshawn Lockman
reviews.content: My family and I travelled to Boston for spring break, this hotel was a great choice. Step outside and the Boston waterfront, Fanueil Hall and much more is right there. They are doing construction on the lobby areas which did not affect us at all and will be done soon. Lovely pool and hot tub, great views from our room and super nice staff. The price was more than I'd hoped to pay for this trip but all in all, it was worth it and the kids LOVED it (ages 8 and 12).

reviews.author: Anastacio Kilback
reviews.content: We have stayed in or near Boston a few times before, but this was our first time at the Long Wharf. We were able to get a decent rate as a Marriott Rewards members - $195/night (although still a little hard to swallow with tax and daily parking fees but it was our five year anniversary). The location was by far one of the better places we have ever stayed in Boston. It was not even a five minute walk to Fanueil Hall/Quincy Market, and the North End was less than 10 minutes away. It was right along the water, which we probably would have taken advantage of more had the weather been nicer, but it was still a beautiful area with plenty to do. We also took advantage of one of the trolley tours which in some ways was like door to door service because the main stop is on the side of the hotel. I would definately return to the Marriott Long Wharf, and think it would be a fabulous place for the kids. Besides the aquarium, and other area attractions, there is a small park next to the hotel that has a small playscape and there is even a carousel just outside the back entrance. I cannot really comment on the service or amenities because we did not use any of the facilities or have a need to call the front desk or house keeping. The only somewhat of a downside is that the hotel does not have an area for free coffee and fruit (not a necessity, just a nice perk) although there was a Starbucks on the lower floor and there is the option to make it in your room. We were not expecting a free breakfast with our stay, so to keep the cost minimal (we splurged on lunch and dinner) we just grabbed bagels at Quincy Market in the morning. Overall, it was a very nice stay, and based on the location alone, I would definately recommend it to anyone with or without children. Our stay was pleasant, our room was clean, the beds were comfortable, there was a big screen TV in the room. In and out, our needs were met. Wish the price could have been slightly lower, but we knew that going into our stay that we could get a place with a lower price and free breakfast just outside of the mainstay. . . but then you lose the ambiance of staying in the city.

reviews.author: Ms. German Schowalter
reviews.content: We went to Boston to tour the city and stayed here. Overall, this is a nice hotel with a great location. Very close to Quincy Market, NE Aquarium, the waterfront and the Italian section of Boston. Rooms were clean and the pool and gym are excellent. Only complaints are relatively minor...we expect that for the price you would get queen beds instead of twins. Also, service by the bartenders in the restaurant and one of the bellhops did not meet my expectations for a hotel of this calibre. Otherwise, would definitely stay there again due to location and cleanliness of the hotel.

reviews.author: Cheyanne Rohan
reviews.content: We chose this hotel because it was close to the attractions we wanted to visit: aquarium, IMAX theater, Quincy Market, etc. We were steps away from the wharf where the cruises launched and the trolley bus tour also departed from the corner in front of the hotel. We stayed for two nights and the room was OK - we had requested two double beds, but were given a King room with a cot. The space was pretty tight with the cot in the room and the bathroom was on the small side. The room was very clean and the beds (and cot) were very comfortable.

reviews.author: Celestino O'Conner
reviews.content: I have stayed at the Marriott Long Wharf several times while in Boston for both business and pleasure. Overall, it is standard Marriott fare in the lobby, lounge, and restaurant. Everything is adequate and the beds are great. However, the hotel does also offer a great view from most rooms and an excellent location for visiting the historic and business areas of downtown Boston. Overall, I recommend this hotel and have chosen it myself for most visits to this fine city.

reviews.author: Lukas Murray
reviews.content: The Marriot is located right next to the Aquarium, the wharf with all of the different ferries to various places, Fanuel Hall, and the gem of the city, the North End. You can just park your car and walk any where you want, or hop on a shuttle and tour the city. It was nice and clean, quiet even though it is a huge hotel, and very comfortable, even with 4 adults in one room. The bathroom doors were a little odd - it was two small doors that opened out into the room. So they were sort of in the way at times, and not that easy to shut in a hurry. But the view was great and the stay was pleasant. I am looking forward to going back, even though it is pretty pricey to stay ($300 to start), the location is well worth it.

reviews.author: Lisette Hodkiewicz
reviews.content: We were attracted by a recent special which was run by Marriott. We stayed two nights in a room which actually had a view of Long Wharf and the boat docks. It was a quiet, spacious, well-ventilated, comfortable room, clean, with some nice new touches since our previous stay at least four years ago. Thereâ€™s a nice flat screen TV, and a refrigerator to replace the mini-bar (nice touch). Pillows are a little too soft for our tastes, and I doubled up on mine. The breakfast buffet is as well-equipped as it ever was. As we experienced in the past, check-in was quick and professional and the staff remains friendly.

title: Offa's Dyke Path

description: Hotel
name: Blue Bell

reviews.author: Kariane Brekke
reviews.content: A/C-heat does not work, however Staff did supply a tiny "space heater" 9-8-11' Toilet flushes slowly and 9-10-11, upon flushing, it EXPELLED the entire bowl of human (my) waste onto the bathroom floor. - Staff (M) offered me a "free breakfast" when I reported the disgusting situation and threaten to have Security remove me from the Hotel when I declined the breakfast offer and pressed the Desk Manager for the Hotel Manager's name and telephone contact information. The Manager's name was given as Rob --, but he couldn't be contacted on a weekend. I had obviously pre-paid or Security might have been needed. I WOULD NOT GO NEAR THIS HOTEL AGAIN EVEN IF SOMEONE HAD ME AT GUN POINT !!! (One of the two "Desk Managers (C. S.) did agree to and accompanied me at my request to the room to witness the disgusting mess in person)

reviews.author: Tate Swift
reviews.content: My husband and I were only in town for one night. I decided to cancel our reservation at the Nine Zero and book here to save a little money. Huge mistake. I get the hotel is old, I expected that and it is charming in that way. What I didn't expect was 10 year old televisions and no free internet. The location is good and for business I could see the draw (except for the no internet). I think for the price you can find better at a place nearby. The check in and check out process was quick and painless. The beds were decent but the bathrooms showed their age and the floors are very slippery when wet, even with a towel down. Beware of the concierge, they seemed to be pushy when it came to getting a cab or taking the hotel truck, although either will set you back about $30 to Logan.

title: Offa's Dyke Path

description: 1870's Gothic mansion set in 280 acres of mature gardens and tranquil parkland with mullioned windows, oak panelling and beautiful staircase. 10 individually designed rooms and suites, all ''en suite'' with unlimited Wi-Fi. No pets allowed. Afternoon tea and home made cakes in the ''Offas Dyke Bar''. Lunch 12.00–14:00, Dinner 18.30–21:00 served in one of 4 restaurants: the ''Cwm Dining Room'', the ''Mahogany Panelled Restaurant'', the ''William Morris Room'', or the ''Shropshire Lounge''. Local ingredients and suppliers are used wherever possible with many ingredients traceable to source. Graded *** with Welsh Tourist Board. The most luxorius camp site I have met. Camp by lake next to facilities block. Phone owner for entrance code. Pay £5 pppn (2014) in the morning to groundsman. 5 star hotel next door are polite but claim to know nothing about camping as its under separate ownership. Hotel
name: Mellington Hall Hotel

reviews.author: Stephen Graham
reviews.content: End of a wonderful trip saw us land here. In a nutshell - rude bell staff (note I will not tip poor service and bad attitudes just because you expect it), rude front desk staff and staff who had to be kept out of the room - you may have been desperate to clean it but check out is 12 (and no later). This hotel has the smallest hotel room I have ever seen in the USA. Poor beyond words. Great location but that's all it's got going for it (don't be hopeful from the grand entrance and internet pictures!)

reviews.author: Madelyn Rolfson
reviews.content: I spent one night here on a quick getaway to do my own historical walking tour. The hotel touts its own history and though nice, I was not particularly impressed overall. The Park Plaza seemed almost as though it was trying to be too many things to too many people...more than one wedding booked (large lighted ,glossy photos and names of couples in lobby detracting from the historic decor), lots of high maintenance vacationers, European travelers, even airline flight crews. Amid the shuffle, I felt a bit overlooked as a lone traveler. At one point, I waited in a long line for the Concierge to ask for a walkable map of the historic African-American sites trail, only to be told hurriedly that they didn't have any but "the trail starts on the other side of the park". The group in front of me in line however, booked a boat tour, made dinner reservations for a family of 4, and got directions from the Concierge. All I wanted was a map. Maybe it would have been better had I not been traveling in the middle of the summer? In any case, the rooms have a nice historic flair (skeleton key doors) and are small but perfectly acceptable. The room was clean but my bed sheet was stained, which was pretty unexpected considering the caliber of the hotel. Overall, I could not have asked for a better location and for the seasoned traveler who needs little direction or attention, it was a reasonable choice.

reviews.author: Fabian Langosh
reviews.content: I booked a junior suite at the Park Plaza for our family vacation. Upon check in, there were no junior suites, so we were upgraded to some fabulous 2-room suite on the 15th floor of the Towers. It was lovely and the 15th floor suites include complimentary evening appetizers and morning breakfast. The 2-room suite accomodated us nicely and we were very gracious for the upgrade. However, the airconditioning would not go below 77-degrees (It was set to be 64-degrees when we arrived)!. Granted, on day one, Boston got hit by the near 100-degree heat wave. On day 2, i made 3 requests between 9 am and 10:45 pm for the AC to be looked at and i also requested a portable fan for the room. Sleeping night number one was miserable, difficult and hot! Anyhow, after my 3rd request for assistance, and it was now 11:15 PM and I needed to go to bed, so i walked down to the front desk and nicely explained my unhappiness and discomfort. The desk clerk appologized profusely and gave me her portable box fan from behind the counter. I was happy to have a fan at last, but displeased that my 3 earlier requests were disregarded. On day number 3 the room temp with AC would still only go down to 77, although the weather out was pleasant and mildat 78-degrees. We opened our windows and slept with them open because it was cooler out than in. All other aspects of the hotel were grand. The location right by a T station and 1 block from the Boston Public Garden can't be beat. The hotel is not cheap to stay at, and we were still paying a good chunk of change to stay there regardless of recieving an upgrade, so it is not accecptable to disregard a guests request for room comfort. Still, despite the AC situation, I would recommend this hotel and I would stay there again.

reviews.author: Makenzie Towne
reviews.content: We stayed on the 15th floor in the Towers. The price was very reasonable for a major city hotel ($130/night) and if you get a room on the 15th floor, you have access to a private elevator, free wifi, a private lounge with free continental breakfast and afternoon hors-d'oeuvres. The room was very clean and comfortable. The location is fantastic - a block away from the Gardens/Boston Common, two blocks from the shops in Back Bay, close to the beginning of the Freedom Trail. We caught a Red Sox game and actually were able to walk all the way to Fenway Park without much problem (took us about 40 minutes). You can also walk to the South End where there are some great restaurants.

reviews.author: Trevor Predovic
reviews.content: I found my room to be somewhat dark and gloomy but I suppose that relates in part to the age and historic ambiance of the hotel.The garage parking was expensive,$44 per day.Also they charge for internet access and local calls.The staff however were helpful,especiaaly the concierge Frank Gallagher.He recommended Old Town Trolley Tours who were excellent.

title: Offa's Dyke Path

description: accommodation and food
name: The Oxford Arms

reviews.author: Ashtyn Hansen
reviews.content: The Park Plaza is a beautiful, historic hotel in a great location near Boston Common and all of the shopping and restaurants in the Back Bay area. They have retained the historic quality while updating the hotel so the common areas (lobby, restaurants, and meeting space) are really nice. For a business traveler with all expenses covered, it is a great hotel. For anyone else, it is rather expensive even beyond the room rate and Boston taxes that apply to all the hotels in this area. The Park Plaza basically has no parking so you must use valet parking that was $44 a night (plus tips), which seemed very high even by Boston standards. Web access was over $10 a day, and it was unreliable. The bars and restaurants were expensive compared to other places in the neighborhood so leave the hotel to eat. I would generally not recommend it for families as the historic hotel rooms and especially the bathrooms are too small for more than one or two people. There is also no pool.

title: Offa's Dyke Path

description: Wi-Fi.
directions: in a cul-de-sac off Lion St
name: Davlyn B&B

reviews.author: Dannie Hintz
reviews.content: The rooms were clean. The linens were nice. There was no wifi in the rooms-strange in 2011. The entire experience was outdated. But the service was excellent.

reviews.author: Marianna Williamson
reviews.content: We paid extra to be on the "Concierge Level". These "recently renovated" rooms are no different than the rooms on the lower levels. No view and the same small "charming rooms" as in the rest of the hotel. The lounge amenities aren't enough to account for the difference in cost. The street noise (despite a room on the 15th floor) kept us up all night and didn't quiet down even on Sunday morning. The hotel is in a nice spot with great access to many downtown offerings but there are far better options in the area.

title: Offa's Dyke Path

description: Accommodation and food service; Free Wi-Fi.
name: The Old Pandy Inn

reviews.author: Edna Considine Sr.
reviews.content: Location excellent, atff worked really hard especially conference food/beverage/IT, meertings,. Rooms small and dated (bathroom- think cruise ship) but typical for a city location. What really ruined my weekened was the 3 calls a day I needed to make to security to report my neighbors on the 7th floor who were smoking non stop. Colleagues reported the same on the 8th and 14th floors. Our clothes, towels and linens really smelled bad. The hotel is non smoking and has a fine policy but clearly this not enforced, Worse is that in such an old building, a fire would be a disaster. The hotel needs to be proactive and police their smoking guests!!!!

reviews.author: Eldora Bayer
reviews.content: This was the second we stayed at this hotel in the past five years. The location is great with the green line a block away and the commuter rail about four. The lobby is beautiful and has the golden era ritzy feel. The rooms are small and need a little freshness (the hotel opened in 1927). Service and staff are helpfull, polite and professional. Parking, room service and the restaurants are pricey; there are better deals elsewhere (MJ O'Connors). We stayed on the coldest days since 2006 and the hotel had some heating issues (along with the rest of the city). They did what was humanly possible to help and it really wasn't an inconvience. Would I stay here again? Yes for the right price. If you go in the warmer times of year you can walk to almost everything. And if you can't walk the green and red lines are nearby.

reviews.author: Fernando Lebsack
reviews.content: Staying at this hotel was fantastic and a highlight of my honeymoon to the USA everything was top shelf and reasonably priced. We stayed in the Towers suites and would recommend to anyone. Cant wait to stay here again when visiting Boston.

title: Offa's Dyke Path

description: Accommodation and food services.
name: The Park Hotel

reviews.author: Lacy Bergstrom V
reviews.content: I really dont think you can get a better value for your money than staying here. Great rate, very classy, great location, terrific value. By the way, some of the most comfortable pillows and cases ive had at any hotel. Will stay again and would recommend.

reviews.author: Neva Gerhold
reviews.content: The hotel was everything we had expected from the Park Plaza, until there was a knock on the door. We certainly had not expected the front desk to send us up a bottle of wine and a plate of cheese and crackers with a personalized note extending their wishes for us to enjoy our fundraiser that evening. Remarkable customer service in an already wonderful location and beautiful hotel.

reviews.author: Jan Goyette III
reviews.content: This was our first stay at Park Plaza. It would be hard to have a better location: a half block from the public garden and all the shopping of Boylston and Newbury streets. Just a short walk to Trinity Church (a must see), Copley Place, Prudential Center. The hotel is quite lovely - spacious lobby, lounge, and numerous restaurants. We splurged for a concierge level room (they call it the tower level) at a conference rate of $365 per night, including tax, so quite expensive I think. Our room was spotlessly clean, the king bed was very comfortable, and the large flat screen TV worked ok. The bathroom was miniscule. In fact we could not open the door all the way, because the toilet blocked the door! And the bathtub has this very strange gel-like padding on the bottom. It made for a rather dangerous shower, since you had to worry about keeping your balance. Just don't close your eyes, or you might fall over! The size of the room and bathroom are typical of older, historic hotels. But this bathroom was REALLY teeny. The concierge level had a nice lounge that served an ok breakfast and a nice afternoon snack with a cash bar. Overall the Park Plaza is an ok place to stay. Just don't expect a large room like you might get at the newer hotels. It's an historic building. Great staff, very accomodating.

reviews.author: Desiree Luettgen
reviews.content: Excellent location and conveniently near transport options. Very comfortable rooms and courteous staff. A very historic hotel with nostalgic ambiance. Highly recommended.

reviews.author: Shania Franecki
reviews.content: I cannot say enough good things about this hotel. It is very elegant. Everyone there is accommodating. They are just simply amazing!

reviews.author: Mozelle Kub
reviews.content: Located very close to train station. Frank was ablle to get us very good tickets to a Sox game at the last moment. Really liked the "little things" like offering us an umbrella to use when it was pouring rain outside. We have stayed here several times and the service has always been super!!

reviews.author: Clair Labadie III
reviews.content: Having read the reviews for the Boston Park Plaza I was a little worried, but my worries were put to rest after I discovered the exact location and walked into my nice air-conditioned chilled room!! We went July 16th weekend when highs were in the mid 90's! I made it a point to request a room with a king and air conditioning that cranked when we checked in and the front desk came through!! This is a historic hotel with lots of character! There are a ton of dining opportunities in the building itself or right across the street, Legal Seafood, McCormick and Schmicks, PF Changs, among others. Our room was huge and had two separate bathrooms as well (free upgrade to Deluxe)...the bathrooms were on the small side but nice to have my own bathroom!! The shower pressure was great and there was plenty of hot water! The bed was super comfortable with both down pillows and regular foam pillows. TV wasn't plasma or LCD but was 32 inch and had plenty of channel opportunity. coffee maker was a krups machine with 4 servings to brew! The fitness Center wasn't your typical 10x10 room....they had several precor machines, free weights, a yoga room and strength training machines! If I go back to Boston I will definitely stay at the Boston Park Plaza! We booked through Priceline and got a fantastic deal!!!

reviews.author: Earnestine Kautzer
reviews.content: I stayed twice at the Boston plazas and had slightly different experiences. It's located in Back Bay, which is a great area that is accessible to many things and nice to walk around during the day. At night, it's quite deserted and there isn't even many take away or fast food options if you are looking to eat (I had to eat food from a CVS store..). The check in the first time was breezy, however he wouldn't let me use my credit card that still had the generic card as I hadn't received the new one. The signature matched my identifitication.. but anyway, go to the atm he tells me. The atm was out of service, so i had to walk to a bank. Minor inconvenience, but inconvenience in any event. The lobby is very nice and there are many staff members on hand to assist you in you need help. The room was very-very large (as big as a suite almost) and had 2 double beds. There was a desk area, lcd and windows that opened to a sheltered roof that clearly many people sat out and smoked on. The bathroom was large in size with a full bath and seat in there, so perhaps it was a disabled access room (explains the size?). My only complaint about the room was the noise associated with the old heat/cool system, so loud. The room was next to the ice machine too, so some noise. The breakfast was sufficient (fruit plate, berries, muffins and coffee with juice) and there were no complaints with service otherwise. There was a candy/drink machine in the iceroom which was convenient also. But they didn't accept many coins or notes (evens ones listed, just shoots them back.. randomly), so I think they need updating or calibrating. The second stay I was placed in a much smaller and dated room. The bathroom was a lot smaller, but still had a bathtub. The tv was older however, but there was an nice street view available. I received an express checkout slip under the door the night of leaving, which was missed during the first stay. The girl checking me in accepted my credit card with no questions. All in all a pleasent stay, some inconsistencies within the hotel - but with a hotel of this size.. you half expect it. Gym is small but open 24 hours. Some of the equipment needs updating.

title: Offa's Dyke Path

description: Accommodation and food services
name: The Bell Inn

reviews.author: Larue Jacobs
reviews.content: After reading a number of negative reviews, I was afraid the Park Plaza may have deteriorated since the 1980s when I had been there for several meetings. I decided to book anyway because I got a great rate and the location was fairly close to where I needed to be. Wow, am I glad I did! The hotel has been kept up with new carpets, drapes, fresh paint, and renovated bathrooms. The bed linens were beautiful and comfortable. Everything was spotlessleslly clean. In other reviews I noticed people complaining about noise/thin walls, but my husband and I did not notice anything like that. Our 3-day stay was quiet and thoroughly pleasant. We would definitely come back. Tip: If you want to park and leave your car for the duration of your stay, you can save by using the self-parking garage across the street, but be aware it does not have in & out privileges.

reviews.author: Liliane Graham
reviews.content: No tea, coffee etc in room, front desk staff helpful. Rooms big but thats about it. Parking very expensive.

reviews.author: Enrico Legros
reviews.content: This hotel is in a great location. However, the hotel rooms need to match the lobby by being updated. The furniture looked like it was taken from a garage sale or off someone's curb. The bathrooms need to be updated and looked dirty even though it was clean. The woodwork was very worn and looked dirty as well as the wallpaper being torn in spots. The heating and windows need to be replaced with more efficient ones since there was a horrible draft and the thermostat needed to be turned up to accomodate the draft. You could hear everything going on outside as it was noisy. The bellmen and parking attendants were very friendly and helpful.

reviews.author: Myrna Bauch
reviews.content: Very nice, but very old hotel! Has been kept up nicely, and is very ornate. Lobby is breath taking!! Only problem we had, was the toilet was so close to the tub, made it difficult to use it. Oh, and the prices for room service are astronomical, so be prepared to pay a lot for that luxury. Where the hotel is located is really close to good eats, so no worries there! Plus, they do offer a shuttle bus tour of Boston that I highly recommend! You need to book ahead though, it fills up quickly. Very reasonable prices though.

reviews.author: Lisa Kulas
reviews.content: I booked this hotel for Thanksgiving weekend via Priceline. Then after reading reviews here, I was initially disappointed, especially given comments about the small bathrooms and poor service (I went with my wife and children, ages 4 years and 6 months). Our experience was fantastic. To address my initial concerns, I'd say that the bathrooms were small but that the service was very good (special thanks to Ari, who worked the front desk). Further, the other folks at the front desk seemed courteous and helpful when approached by hotel guests. A few comments about the Deluxe room we stayed in...The room was well-maintained (not 4-star quality, but I wasn't expecting this). Bathrooms, as others have noted, are tiny, and the tile floors could use a little refurbushing. When I asked about why the rest of the hotel was updated but not the bathroom floors, one of the employees indicated that the tiles were untouched to retain hotel's "charm." For me, the small bathroom size was not a big deal, but I can see how it might alter the experience for some. Regarding amenities, we weren't a frequent consumer of the hotel's ancillary offerings. We didn't use the business center (not free), breakfast (expensive), gym (I'm building a tire, if you know what I mean). So, buyer beware. The hotel's lobby is fantastic. Christmas decorations were already up, and there is plenty of seating - several guests were reading newpapers or enjoying take-out dessert. Very spacious and luxurious setting, all in all. Parking is $40/night at the hotel. I opted for the covered parking across the street (where Maggiano's guests park) because it's slightly cheaper at $31/night. Last but not least, the location is perfect. The Arlington station (green line) is less than a block away. Boston Common/Public Garden is a block or two away. Chinatown is a 10-minute walk (with kids). And there are several dining options either inside the hotel (McCormick & Schmicks, Melting Pot, Ben & Jerrys) or within 1 block (Smith & Wollensky, Finale for dessert, PF Changs, Maggiano's, Legal Seafood). I'd stay here again.

reviews.author: Walker Grimes
reviews.content: Possibly one of the worst Starwood properties I've ever stayed in. While the lobby is convincing enough that this is a worthy hotel, immediately upon entering my room, I realized that this hotel was completely overrated. I'm usually pretty laid back about this sort of thing, but I'm pretty sure my first apartment in Chicago, after I graduated from college, was nicer than this. Bathroom is decaying and its clear there's been no attempt to even attempt an upgrade (the fixtures are all cheap and old). TV is circa 1990. Room generally feels old and dirty (see attached pictures of bathroom and window shade). Gym smelled and many pieces of equipment were rusty. Other comments on this site regarding the general lackadaisical attitude of the concierge were right on, although the front desk staff was helpful. Overall, I fully understand why the other Starwood properties were sold out and this one wasn't (even at almost half the cost!).

reviews.author: Connie Pfeffer
reviews.content: Although this is one of the "Historic Hotels of America", it is definitely in need of a facelift. Good points: comfortable beds and pillows; courteous staff; good location to shops, restaurants, subway. Down side: no coffee maker in rooms; rooms are very dated and poorly maintained. The bathrooms are very tiny for American standards, along with dirty, cracked caulking, poorly draining tubs - you get the picture. Also, they appear to be very stingy with toiletries. I went two days in a row with one bar of soap for the shower and sink until I swiped another from the housekeeper's cart. After four days here, still am not provided with another body lotion. Time for another swipe...Rooms are noisy. On the 11th floor, the traffice noise is quite noticeable (and there are a lot of sirens in Boston). The fire alarm system malfunctioned - although it DID NOT AWAKEN us to evacuate (which is worrisome), the very loud announcements that it was OK to reenter the building did. Then we were in bed thinking what the heck - what if there had been a real fire??? Obviouisly, my first choice for another stay.

reviews.author: Aurelie Hessel
reviews.content: We stayed here for two nights at the beginning of August as our original hotel had overbooked and moved us to here. At first I was a little apprehensive as it was a lower grade hotel but can honestly say that it was the best thing that could have happened. Our stay was to take a look around the city and as such the hotel was in the best location possible. All the resturants and cafes around the hotel (Underneath) were great and were ideal no matter what kind of meal you were looking for. The service in the hotel was very good and the receptionist very cheerful and helpful. The room had everything we needed apart from a great veiw but it was OK. Everything worked in the room and a blown lightbulb was replaced very quickly. Overall a great location and very nice hotel for the money paid.

title: Offa's Dyke Path

description: 8 award winning 4* holiday cottages near Buxton, Bakewell in Derbyshire Peak District sleeping up to 28. Dog, pet, children, family, group friendly
name: Wheeldon Trees Farm

reviews.author: Fernando Jacobi
reviews.content: I can't wait to go back there! My wife and I had never been to Hawaii so we chose the Westin based on recommendations. I can see why. Beautiful grounds on the beach and a spectacular pool. Just next to Whaler's Village where there are plenty of shops and restuarants for happy hour and dinner. Just down the highway from Lahaina. Rooms were just fine, for what little time we spent there. I would recommend an ocean view though because the sunsets are unbelievable. The only negative was the parking situation if you get back in the evening with a rental car. We would stay there again, and we can't wait to. Since this trip in October of '06 we've stayed at The Ritz Carlton in Puerto Rico and the Westin Maui blows that away...not to mention that we enjoyed Hawaii over the Caribbean hands down.

reviews.author: Cecile Daniel
reviews.content: We stayed at this hotel for only one night after receiving an offer from the Sheraton to move because they were overbooked. We wish we would have stayed here the entire time! This hotel is outstanding! The facilities are awesome, and the lobby is very impressive! If you're looking for a hotel with the "wow" factor, this is definitely it. Also, it's in close proximity to the beach @ the Sheraton, so we could have just walked down the shore to snorkel at Black Rock. We visited the spa, and it is truly "heavenly"! Everything about this hotel is tasteful and luxurious. I am amazed it is not ranked higher, and we are pretty picky. We will definitely return!

reviews.author: Wilber Rodriguez
reviews.content: We were "invitied" by Westin for the same 6day/5night deal others have mentioned; $150 a night for a piece of paradise? Okay! It was a very pleasant experience. We didn't want to pay for the upgrade; we knew we would spend in restaurants, etc. but did talk to the manager about our anniversary. He put us on the 10th floor, mtn view, recently renovated room, smaller than other Westins, but we knew that ahead of time from research. The armoire and all the drawers available were quite suffiicient, and there was actually room under the beds for our luggage, and with four of us, that was a big help. The heavenly beds, wireless internet, and small frig; what more could you ask for at this price? Oh, yeah, how about a bottle of wine and chocolate covered strawberries sent up to our room from the manager? We were greeted with leis at the door upon arrival, and no, the lobby is not as over the top as other hawaiian hotels, but very pretty with the koi pond and waterfalls and birds. Yes it was a busy hotel, it was the holidays (Jan 2-7); there are a lot of families there enjoying themselves; honestly, don't go to a resort if you want to be alone. We ate breakfast by the pool one rainy morning; the spinach benedict was yummy, and large enough to share for two. I used the work out room, but didn't have to wait for a machine like someone else did. We ate at the dinner at the lower Leilani Grill; great location, food not really memorable; lunch at the Hula Grill, goat cheese pizza was tasty and our teens said they made the best virgin pinas. In Lahaina, we had a wonderful dinner at the Lahaina Fish Company (get the scallops), and another night a delicious meal at the Lahaina Store and Grill, a new restaurant (the lamb lollies were to die for!) To end our trip, we rented a condo in Wailea, at the Ekolu Village for three nights. Found an ocean view unit from VRBO.com. We had a great experience overall.

title: Peak District

description: 5 star luxury holiday cottages near Tenby, Pembrokeshire, Wales. Ideal for the Pembrokeshire Coast National Park, walking, beaches and other activities.
name: East Jordeston Cottages

reviews.author: Kade Orn
reviews.content: It's a great deal in a nice hotel in the heart of Napa wine country. The staff was top-notch. Within hours of making our initial reservation, the front desk made our reservations at the French Laundry and sent us other recommendations for restaurants in the area. Upon, arriving they provided plenty of information about regional wineries. It's also within within walking distance to the many incredible restaurants and wineries in Yountville. Free breakfast is served daily and surpasses what most hotels serve as a continental breakfast. I have no complaints and would happily stay there again.

reviews.author: Shad Gusikowski
reviews.content: I was able to take advantage of a Zozi coupon, but Napa Valley Lodge is a bargain at full price. From the moment I walked in to check in, everything was perfect. I was warmly greeted. I had a room at the far end looking out over a vineyard. A great bottle of wine awaited me in the spotless room. Internet was fast and free. Loved the beautiful renovated bathrooms and first-class toiletries. Unfortunately, I did not have time to go for a swim or use the hot tub. But, I can't wait to go back and swim some laps in the beautiful, heated pool. Breakfast was very nice, bountiful, and fresh. If I have to offer one less than glowing comment, it would be that my bed, sheets, and pillows at home are more to my liking.

reviews.author: Abigail Crona
reviews.content: The Napa Valley lodge is ideally situated inn the charming town of Yountville and a short drive from all the fabulous vineyards near by. Our room was spacious, clean and tastefully, yet simply appointed. The bathroom was immaculate and recently renovated with lovely tile and seamless shower. We had a great little patio overlooking the pool. The plus was that it was within walking distance of the fabulous restaurants such as French Laundry and Bouchon. We did not eat their breakfast buffet, opting to walk to local eateries instead. The lodge is more like a motel in the sense that the room doors face outside to the parking lot, but we really enjoyed our stay there. The Location was fabulous and I plan to stay there again!

reviews.author: Harvey Skiles
reviews.content: We enjoyed our stay at the Napa Valley Lodge. It was the perfect place to stay in the Napa Valley. The town of Yountville, CA is beautiful. It has the best restaurants, great shops, delicious bakery, streets to wonder and spectacular views! It is so easy to get to the vineyards, and there are many wine tasting opportunities in downtown. The hotel provided free wine tasting in the lobby many evenings. The hotel breakfast was delicious. Relaxing in the hot tub or sitting by the fire pit in the evening was the perfect ending to a glorious day in the wine country. I would recommend staying on the 2nd floor as we could hear people above us. Also a room with a view is best!

reviews.author: Dock Gleichner
reviews.content: My husband and I live in the bay area and wanted to get away for the weekend without having to fly to our destination. Although Napa is only 45 minutes away once we checked into our hotel we felt miles and miles away from our day to day lives. The Napa Valley Lodge was just what we needed. The service was outstanding. The complimentary breakfast was delicious. Our room was lovely with an incredible view that overlooked the pool and beautiful vine covered hills. We spent one day touring local eateries and wineries and the next day recuperating by the pool. The pool side service was great and my husband and I treated ourselves to massages. Loved loved loved this place. We are already talking about the same exact trip next year!! BTW....the location is fantastic. Yountville is our favorite town. The best restaurants in the area all within walking distance. So feel free to eat, drink, and then safely walk back to the hotel!!

reviews.author: Fabiola Leannon
reviews.content: I traveled with my family and we loved the free breakfast. The rooms were amazing and the pool is beautiful and a great place to get together with friends and family. The rooms and bathrooms were very spacious, clean and comfortable. The lobby is very nice and enjoyed the afternoon cookies and wine tasting. The staff was very courteous and helpful and went above and beyond to assist my family. Our room was right off the pool and was so peaceful and quiet. Can't wait to return next year.

reviews.author: Terry Baumbach PhD
reviews.content: The location of this hotel is fabulous! The town of Yountville is definitely the place to stay. Walking distance to many 5 star restaurants, shops, and wine tasting rooms. A short drive to all the famous Napa Wineries. Try to reserve a room upstairs (it's quieter) and overlooking the pool. It's quite beautiful.We went for the luxury king suite and were not disappointed. Flat screen t.v, super comfy bed, 2 person tub, fluffy robes, and a fireplace with a Duraflame log. The outdoor pool is heated to 90 degrees so you can enjoy it year round, which we did. The front desk staff were very respectful and helpful with reservations. This was a wonderfully romantic place to get away to.

reviews.author: Tyshawn Howell
reviews.content: I spent New Year's here, waited until the last minute to make plans and was really pleased with the warm and attentive service we received from our first phone call. The room was spacious with a beautiful view. The breakfast was beautifully presented.

title: Pembrokeshire

description: 5 star small exclusive, family-run park.
name: Mounts Bay Caravan Park

reviews.author: Cortez Gutkowski
reviews.content: We stayed at the NVL for 6 nights mid-March. We were more than pleased with our king room on the second floor of the hotel. The room was very spacious, clean, modern, with a wood-burning fireplace that we lit each evening. The bathroom was recently remodelled with slate and marble, it was large, with a huge shower and separate make-up area. Breakfast was ok - a bit boring, so we ate at Bouchon Bakery, and the Model Bakery in St. Helena as well. We had surprisingly good weather while there (in the mid-70's), and sat by the pool in the afternoons. The pool area is beside the vineyard, beautifully landscaped, there is a fire-pit close by that is lit in the evenings. The hotel is very close to all of the wonderful restaurants in Yountville (we highly recommend Bottega, Bouchon and Redd!). For the price we paid (hotel web special), the NVL was great value. We probably would not stay there again if the rate was higher than what we paid.

reviews.author: Marianne Metz
reviews.content: We could not resist slipping off to the Napa Valley Lodge for a few days after visiting family in the Bay Area. Yountville has some of the top restaurants (French Laundry among others) in the area and is a very quaint city. The Napa Valley Lodge location is excellent, just a short walk to the center of town but far enough away from the activity to offer a quiet setting. The staff was friendly and the recently remodeled room was perfect, comfortable bed, soft sheets plus a gorgeous shower/bathroom. The pool, fire pit and surrounding grounds were the ideal setting for a glass of wine in the evening. Overall, I highly recommend this hotel.

reviews.author: Cyril Casper
reviews.content: Clean and updated rooms in a beautiful setting. The courtyard and pool area was nice to relax at. The included breakfast was good - fresh fruit, granola, cottage cheese, good breads, cereal, juices, etc. The hotel is close to Hwy 29, but the only time we noticed any slight traffic noise was in the courtyard sitting next to the pool. I would stay here again.

reviews.author: John Terry PhD
reviews.content: The Napa Valley Lodge is great. We had a lovely large, clean room with a balcony overlooking the pool and the surrounding countryside. The service was really friendly and, best of all, there was a food and wine festival in the town when we stayed! The only let-down was the continental buffet breakfast. It was perfecty adequate, but it would've been nice to have had the choice of a cooked one. Still, that's only a minor quibble. If we ever go back there, this will be the place we stay.

reviews.author: Guiseppe Homenick
reviews.content: My husband and I just stayed here for our 5th wedding anniversary and were surprised with all the good reviews it got. For $250.00 plus per night I expected a lot more. The bathrooms are small and old. The room was decorated with weird furniture that didn't match. Our biggest complaint was the breakfast. They advertise a complinentary champagne breakfast buffet with the room. I can't belive they have gotten away with calling it a buffet for this long without every guest complaining. There was NO warm food. It was in a little room off the pool and was a medicore continental breakfast at best. There was danishes, toast, bagels, cereal, and yogurt. The same break\fast you would find at a holiday inn. There are many better choices in the area with better locations and I wish we would have chosen somewhere else for our anniversary!

reviews.author: Freddie Baumbach
reviews.content: This is a very pleasant place to stay in Napa. Rooms are comfortable with charming features including fireplace, balcony, vaulted ceilings and more. The location is perfect...walking distance to wineries, shops and restaurants in St Helena. Situated right off of Rt 29 and easy access to Silverado Trail. Staff was very attentive. Full service spa and fitness facility including a heated lap pool and superb staff right next door. This is not what I would call a "high end, luxury" hotel. More of a low-key inn with no pretense. We enjoyed our stay and would return without hesitation.

title: Penzance

description: On the seafront with amazing sea views.
name: Shoreline Guest House

reviews.author: Josiane Jenkins
reviews.content: We stayed at the Inn during our Christmas vacation. It was wonderful. The staff, both front desk as well as housekeeping, were pleasant and very accommodating. (Polly in particular was a doll!) The breakfast treats were fresh and delicious and the cookies they left in our rooms were amazing! The room was lovely complete with a fireplace and vaulted ceiling. The location was perfect for our first trip to Napa, as there were tons of great vineyards in the immediate area. Twomey, was one of our favorite small tours. Castillo di Amorosa was especially interesting as it was a reconstructed Italian Castle! Amazing! The Wine Spectator Greystone restaurant, part of the Culinary Institute of America is right down the road also. We had a great meal there. Also great for casual dining we liked Pizzera Tra Vigne right at the Inn. Across the street is Taylorâ€™s Refresher, a great old fashion drive-in, recently featured on the Food Networkâ€™s "Diners, Drive-ins, and Dives." Worth the wait in line! Our stay was magical and helped to make for a very memorable holiday.

reviews.author: Noemy Zieme
reviews.content: Excellent Service; Friendly, Accomodating Staff; Great Value We took the bus from the main train station to the hotel. The hotel is located in the midst of a lovely olive grove, which is a wonderful setting, but that means the bus stop is not close to the hotel. If you have cumbersome luggage, be prepared for a tedious 10 min. hike. Aside from the jaunt from the bus stop (which they cannot be faulted for since their setting is delightful), we have absolutely no complaints about the hotel. The staff were accomodating and acquired reservations to the various museums for us upon request. We dined once in the evening at the hotel's restaurant and enjoyed the entire meal. They even let us sit by the fire place with our wine after the restaurant had closed down - they just asked that we turn out the lights when we left. The hotel rooms and living areas are furnished like a home - cozy and inviting. To top it off, the price is a steal. We highly recommend Villa Rondini (oh, and you can get great views of the city from the hotel gardens and grounds).

reviews.author: Emmie White
reviews.content: I was visiting relatives with my wife and children in west London and stayed in this hotel for 8 nights. The location is excellent, everything is within walking distance, the prices unbeatable, the rooms were very clean and the staff were friendly. The price also included breakfast which was continental. The reception was open 24 hours. We do recommend this hotel and we will definetely come back.

reviews.author: Maxwell McLaughlin
reviews.content: I had to stay at this hotel because all the others nearby were fully booked. The Continental advertises cheap rooms in the London Evening Standard, but when I rang up the cheap rooms were not available and the man who answered the phone at the hotel was rude to me and said they were fully booked. I then called in at the hotel, where I was offered a cheaper room - but still not as cheap as their adverts. The room itself was dreadful. The radiator didn't work so I could not regulate the temperature. The tiny television only had one channel. There were no towels in the bathroom, which was cramped and filthy. The hotel is very noisy and seems to be right next to a main train line as trains were thundering past all the time. Avoid this place at all costs. I told the man that was rude to me on the phone that I would be writing a review and he said go and do it. I sincerely hope he is reading this.

reviews.author: Kamille Kris
reviews.content: Dauphine is in a perfect location. It's one block north of Bourbon Street and a sanctuary away from the crowds. They have some of the most comfortable beds that we've stayed in in the Quarter. The continental breakfast has a good selection, but shorter hours than other hotels we've stayed at in New Orleans. We really enjoy our favorite bartender, Lisa. We visit her when we are in town. Their bar is an old brothel and is a relaxing setting. They also have a nice poolside garden setting. The hotel is clean and comfortable. I recommend it highly.

reviews.author: Gabriella Stracke
reviews.content: We stayed in the Hermann annex across the street from the office and had a beautiful room upstairs with exposed brick and beams. The mattress was a memory foam that was so comfortable it prompted us to come home and buy one. The breakfat offers everything you couldimagine and far surpasses the routine breakfast that is included with most hotel and motel stays. From here, you can walk almost anywhere in the Quarter or downtown.

reviews.author: Ulises Swaniawski
reviews.content: Overall we liked the ascetic of the rooms in the Hermann house. They have exposed brick and beams, track lighting on a dimmer switch, non-ugly carpet, modern bathroom/vanity area, and sooo important for older buildings: good water pressure in the shower! Tempurpedic beds - some may not like that - we didn't mind. No complaint with cleanliness. However, we did put the card out to request new sheets one day and didn't get them. Staff is generally good. One guy provided a great recommendation for a place to get delivery dinner on a night my boyfriend hurt is back and we couldn't walk around too much. The continental breakfast does the job. Cereal, hard boiled eggs, yogurt, juice, and various breads/pastries. Waffle station, but we didn't see anyone attempt to use it. Available till 11 on the weekends and 10 weekdays. We did have some noise issues carrying in from the street, but not bad. More annoying was the yappy dog in the room two doors down. We finally called the front desk around 1am and they confirmed they are pet free hotel and would send security. Whether or not they did, we're not sure. And would guess the owners were probably still out clubbing so not much the staff could have done anyway outside of kidnap the dog. But it did eventually quiet down, for whatever reason, and we think they checked out the next day. Note: the Carriage Courtyard is where the breakfast room is located. We peeked in one room while it was being cleaned and they do look really nice as well, but you might get foot traffic noise from people going to and from the breakfast area.

reviews.author: Heaven Turner V
reviews.content: I really like this hotel. We were 2 adults, a teenager, and a 5 year old. Our room was in the back and it was perfectly quiet and clean. Not terribly large, but comfortable. The breakfast was nothing to write home about but we were satisfied. The location was good and close to everything we wanted to see and do. There was a discrepency on our bill when we checked out. Make sure you you print out the confirmation with discounted rate if you have one, if booking in advance. It was fixed immediately and easily with that one piece of paper! The staff is great!

reviews.author: Mr. Leon Stehr
reviews.content: We loved this hotel The room was in the main hotel - we had asked for a quiet room after reading some of the reviews and ours certainly was. It was a little dark but then in January that suited us fine. The town was extremely busy with revellers as there was a key match on at the dome but we heard none of it. The front desk were most helpful we had arrived very late after a delayed flight but they could not do enough for us. Also when asked about trips etc. The hotel was advertised as bed only but the complimentary breakfast was more than adequate and beautifully fresh. A real bonus. Altogether this hotel made our break most enjoyable

title: Penzance

address: Ty’n Rhos, Seion, Llanddeiniolen, CAERNARFON, Snowdonia,LL55 3AE
description: Has superb gardens. There is a large choice of individually decorated rooms and the establishment. It also has its own restaurant, with lounge, bar, main restaurant or conservatory areas, which serves delicious and visually beautiful food sourced locally.
directions: Short drive from the main city, in the countryside
name: Tyn Rhos Country House Hotel Bangor

reviews.author: Warren Yundt
reviews.content: Great location, easy walking distance to all the sights (San Marco, Rialto) but has a local feel in the courtyard and not so touristy. A great breakfast with the staff being very friendly and gracious. Our room was superb, top floor, modern and very comfortable. We slept great every night and loved the over sized bathtub. It's on a canal so water taxi took us right to the hotel. The hotel arranged a Murano trip for us, with a nice water taxi, which was free. The Glass Gallery had lovely pieces which were very spendy and there is a bit of a hard sell but overall very enjoyable. The wifi cost euros, but that seems to be the standard in most of the nicer hotels. My fave hotel of the three big cities we stayed in.

reviews.author: Alayna Smitham
reviews.content: The location is a short walk from St. Marks Square, but away from the hustle and bustle. Our room was clean and very comfortable. Each room was unique in this restored former palace. The water taxi delivered us directly to the steps of the hotel. All of the staff we meet were friendly and efficient. The breakfast buffet was delicious, but we did not eat dinner at the restaurant. I would definitely recommend this hotel to my friends and family, and would stay here again if we return to Venice in the future.

reviews.author: Jamaal Feeney II
reviews.content: My wife and I stayed in the Ruzzini Palace for a 3 night break. Location is perfect - close to the centre of Venice, but away from the really touristy parts. Service was excellent - staff were helpful, polite and friendly. Lovely breakfast (plenty of choice) and fantastic cocktails in the evening (at a very reasonable price - for Venice!). Room was large enough, comfortable and very clean. Had all the facilities we expected. We will definitely be staying there again.

title: Bangor (Wales)

description: Small detached cottage set in stunning country, ideal for birdwatching
name: Carbieston Lodge

reviews.author: Shyann Hyatt
reviews.content: The Encore property is beautiful. The strip-view room I had was quite spacious. There were no noise issues as some have mentioned from outside. The downfall came in service. The front desk was generally reluctant to answer questions and the workers there seemed cold and unfriendly. The only employees who seemed particular friendly were the housekeeping staff. Not what I would have expected from what is trying to be a 5 star hotel. Since many people (myself included) realize that the hotel is a good value for a room but the prices are high in other respects, I have a few suggestions on saving on the extras: (1) Taxi from the airport: always tell the driver to take Paradise Road. If not, once he hears Encore (or Wynn) he will likely take you on the highway and it will double the cost. (2) Water/snacks: walk to 7-11 about 1-2 blocks north of Encore on same side of street. Caveat: the area is not as nice as most of the strip south. Upside: bottled water for $1 instead of $8 in the hotel room. (3) Fashion mall: across from Encore/Wynn. Starbucks for breakfast is half the price of the cafe in the hotel. Also, Sushi Ra has good half price sushi from 5 - 7pm. (4) Boarding pass: Encore/Wynn lets you print it for free in their business center instead of paying their usual $1 per minute internet rate.

reviews.author: Dr. Newton Murazik
reviews.content: We've been in may resorts. This one is the best. I will come back again.

reviews.author: Roel Lebsack
reviews.content: My wife and I stayed at the Encore at Wynn resort last September 4 - 7, 2009. It was our first stay at this resort and I have to admit that it is one of the best resort/casinos in Las Vegas. The rooms were nicely appointed, the beds were comfortable, pillows were super soft and the comforters were suple. Our check-in process went well and the staff at the front desk were courteous and carried themselves in a professional manner. The Encore's pool area is one of the nicer pools in Las Vegas - they provide nice thick and newer towels and you can get poolside service as wait staff is always inquiring if you needed anything at that time. There's a European pool area with a pool bar and gaming tables such as blackjack and craps - so you can cool down at the pool, have a drink at their bar and play some games at your own leisure. I like the accessiblity of the hotel to the Fashion Show mall which is right across the street from it and being at the heart of the strip - accessing other casinos was not a problem. We will definitely be back!

reviews.author: Preston Greenholt
reviews.content: This was our third time in Las Vegas and the best hotel by far,its new stylish and imaculate.Before booking we checked it out on Trip Advisor and read some negative reviews,im sure some people are a bit slow on the uptake.First thing,drinks and food are not cheap but it is a five star hotel which cost millions of dollars to build and to run, this has to be paid for somehow.If you want a beer for a buck and a cheap hot dog go to the places that do that,dont go to a five star resort and expect to live on the cheap.Secondly,thousands stay here every night and tens of thousands pass thru the casino,bars ,restaurants and shops every day.So dont expect the bartender,waitress or hotel manager to remember your name,unless your a high roller its not a personal service type of place.Saying that,the staff were perfect and the food and drinks were as good as it gets.If it takes you 10 or 20 minutes to check in,live with it your not the only person there.Our resort suite was perfect, big bathroom great sitting area with large tv,black out curtains(electric operated) and its true what they say about a Wynn bed.The pool does get a bit packed at the weekend,if your not down there early you wont get a bed.It may be at the quiet end of the strip for some people,but for $15 in a cab you are at Mandalay Bay which is the furthest hotel away on the strip.In summing up,this place is better than the Bellagio,The Venitian,The Paris and the rest,so please dont complain about the price of the food and drinks.When we go back to vegas,we know where we are staying.ps.if you want a quieter room just ask at check in and dont have one that overlooks the pool/night club.

reviews.author: Syble Lueilwitz
reviews.content: The Encore is one of the nicest Hotel that I have stayed. The staff is very friendly. The Hotel rooms are beautiful and cozy. We had the perfect night out we went to Dinner to Switch what a creative looking Restaurant and the food is great, after Dinner we went to see the show LeReve what a show!!!! and after the show we hit the casino. The slots don't payout however, if you go there to have a good time and don't stress over losing a couple of hundred dollars to the slot you be okay. Even though I lost the Casino Host assign to me was wonderful. Overall an excellent choice.

reviews.author: Mr. Cecelia Kohler
reviews.content: I would certainly recommend the Encore - The rooms are huge and luxurious and it feels like every detail has been accounted for. For such a highly rated hotel however, the service is relatively poor. I arrived at the hotel in an oversized vehicle and was advised that the Wynn would account for the parking. This wasn't a hassle as the Wynn is next door. However on arrival at the Wynn, we were sitting in our vehicle and told to wait by hotel staff (approx 30 mins) for them only to tell us to go back to the Encore and park their. Cutting the long story short, we wanted a quick check in after a long journey and it took us over an hour overall to be instructed on where to park. Furious at this point, we proceeded to make a complaint at check in only to be told that the manager could not speak to us. When we were finally spoken to, we were given very little compensation at firsat but were eventually given $100 worth of food coupons and late check out... The maid service is poor and we had to phone twice on a 3 night stay and request they clean our rooms. However despite the above, the hotel design and its facilities are amazing and i certainly would recommend it to anyone seeking an opulant Vegas experience. If you do arrive in an RV...GOOD LUCK!!!

title: Prestwick

description: Four newly renovated one bed-roomed self catering units situated between Barmouth and Dolgellau.
name: Coedmor Self Catering Holiday Cottages

reviews.author: Mallie Block
reviews.content: We'll stay here again! The room was nice size and very clean. The bed was comfortable. We asked at the desk about internet pricing and the very helpful clerk pointed to the computer in the lobby. She said we could get a better rate online than she could give us. She was right. They have a nice pool and hot tub area. Again, very clean and well kept. The location is very good, easy to get in and out. We checked out the breakfast but did not eat there. It is the usual carbfest that all hotels have. All in all, a great place to stay. I would recommend it.

reviews.author: Bart Gulgowski
reviews.content: Did not need to shop around for a motel in Branson. We had stayed here last October and we were very pleased with the accommodations. So, we made reservations again this year. Once again, we were very satisfied with our stay at AmazeInn. Clean rooms, friendly service, great location all add up to a motel we plan to use every time we go to Branson.

reviews.author: Lorenza Beahan
reviews.content: This was the most unexpected stay . I booked this trip online without seeing the hotel i let my partner choose the place. When he told me the great price i expected a DIVE! I was soooooooo wrong!! This is a well maintained, comfortable, courteous hotel. It is located in the best spot to have access to all Branson has to offer!!! Thanks to the staff for a GREAT 1st but not last trip to your beautiful establishment. LC&RS

reviews.author: Era Terry
reviews.content: High rating for value and pillowtop beds. I have stayed in hotels for over 1000 nights for business travel over the years. The bed in this room was more comfortable than most hotels that cost twice or even three times as much. The rooms are simple and all are exterior access. Room is clean and everything works, including a fridge and microwave. Climate control is fairly new, quiet and in good working order. This is a great place to rest after a busy day in Branson, especially if you are searching for an inexpensive hotel. My room had two queen beds, TV with hutch, luggage rack, 3' square table with 2 chairs, basic bathroom, and adequate lighting. The room is a lot like you would find in an older-generation Holiday Inn (except the beds are NICE and the carpets are clean at this hotel). It is obvious that the owner and staff of this hotel want to provide a clean, comfortable, inexpensive place to stay. Great job!

reviews.author: Mae Gottlieb PhD
reviews.content: Rooms are larger than most other hotels. The staff was very accommodating to our needs. Clean rooms. Easy walk to restaurants, shows, etc. Great location.

title: Barmouth

address: Ceilwart Ganol Farm, Llanaber, Barmouth LL42 1YS
description: 5 Star Holiday barns with stunning sea views from the lounge and decking of Penty Buwch and Penty Mochyn.  Situated on an equestrian property that is also home to chickens, ducks, grey faced dartmoor sheep and sometimes pigs.
directions: Just off the main road - look for our signs
name: Beautiful Wales Sea View Luxury Holiday Barns

reviews.author: Zola O'Reilly
reviews.content: e stayed in a small very clean and very basic room.The location was great and we were able to explore Sydney from this base using excellent public transport that was easily accessed from the hotel.I loved the wood paneled walls in the lift lobby.

title: Barmouth

description: 8 bedroom guest house family friendly at the end of Marine Parade, closest guest house to beach.
name: Môr Wyn Guest House

reviews.author: Mr. Demetrius Hudson
reviews.content: Booked one night on our way from Newcastle to NZ through the Entertainment Book not expecting much as it was v.cheap for Sydney. Trip Advisor reviews tipped the balance and came through for us once again. Excellent location, room was smallish but bathroom was big and v.clean. Comfy bed and quiet considering we were on George St. Didn't try the pub grub as we had dumplings and dessert at 2 favourite places both within 2 minutes walk of the hotel. Would definitely stay again!

reviews.author: Eloy Brekke
reviews.content: Love that everything is just a short walk away, the meals were huge and delicious!! Great value for money! Yes the rooms are small but really.. Your only sleeping in them

reviews.author: Mrs. Pascale Mueller
reviews.content: I haven't actually stayed at the Great Southern Hotel yet, but I have got to say that the Great Southern Hotel has exceptional staff and service. My flights to Sydney (today) were cancelled this afternoon due to the ash clouds passing over the air space. This was extremely inconvenient and has messed up many of my business plans. Fortunately, I have one thing less to worry about with GSH. I called the Great Southern Hotel, hoping for a refund although I was aware of their cancellation policy (I should note that I was rather impolite and pushy, but they put up with me and were very patient). Their staff recited their policy as I had expected. A couple of hours later however, Donald from GSH called me to tell me that a refund or change of dates was on the way. This is fantastic service. The staff at GSH really know how to treat customers to keep them coming back. Mind you, they are very strict with their cancellation policy, but in my case, with such unfortunate circumstances, they understood and made my life much much easier!

reviews.author: Hanna Zieme II
reviews.content: While the location was good, pretty much right in Chinatown, that is the only good thing I can say. On checking in we were confronted by a notice saying that there was a 2% surcharge on credit cards. In all our years of business travel, we have hardly ever been charged a surcharge and certainly not 2%. The room was not inspiring - no artwork or anything to break the monotony. The toiletries consisted of one minuscule soap, a combo shampoo/conditioner (1 measly bottle) which left our hair feeling like straw, a shower cap and tissues. There was no mini bar - you had to venture down to reception to purchase anything. The room had no compendium or any hotel information at all. Pillows were uncomfortable. We paid for breakfast vouchers, and what a disappointment - slimy eggs with uncooked white slopping around, anaemic baked beans, the most horrible sausages we have ever tasted, and something that looked like bacon but may not have been. I was woken up the day BEFORE checkout by a call from reception telling me that we had an outstanding balance. We were quite aware of this (internet use, breakfast vouchers) and would have settled as usual on checkout. Why we had to be disturbed and told this is a mystery. I would definitely not recommend this hotel.

reviews.author: Hollie Sauer
reviews.content: This hotel is in a good location just five minutes(walking) from main station it is at the top of the shopping area.Staff at front desk were helpful. rooms a good size and clean.it has internet connection but you pay. will store bags for you but you pay$2 a day which is not bad. pub and food on site

reviews.author: Mrs. Zora Carter
reviews.content: I only paid $94 per night to stay at this hotel. It had been 7 years since I last stayed here and I was pleasantly surprised. Close access to Chinatown and the theatre district - a short stroll to Central Railway Station, and 5 to 10 minute walk to Pitt St Mall. The room was clean and the bed comfortable. I slept very well! It is a cheap nightly price to stay in the Sydney CBD

reviews.author: Jamarcus Nolan
reviews.content: Got a great rate for this hotel - for under $A100 it's cheap and cheerful, a great deal in the city centre. It's 2 blocks away from the central railway station and on the free commuter link bus route. The staff are young, happy and well trained, and look after you well. It's a good hike above a backpackers in quality, in the backpacker district. The rooms aren't by any means designer, but for the money they're clean and do the job, reasonably quiet. Right out the back is MarketCity, for healthy brekkies.
