Then we asked for another room which had patches of carpet on the floor. Forget this hotel if you are light sleeper, tile floors line the hallways and suitcases rolling on the floors are noisy as is anyone walking by. We were on a tight budget and had to be in NYC that day. For around $170 at the time what a rip off!!!! I will go without food and save money to stay in a decent place and thankfully we have since found other hotels better quality for a cheaper price. Oh and yes there is no elevator and if they didn't have my credit card number I would have left on arrival after seeing the foyer!

reviews.author: Rita Jacobi
reviews.content: The other reviews scared me, but I already booked this place before I read them. I don't know about all the other rooms, but our room was pretty nice (not huge), but was very comfortable. I requested a room with two queen beds and not only got 2 queens, but two singles as well! Really cool! The T.V. was small and not very many channels, but hey, we weren't there to watch T.V.! Great location. Nice folks working there. If you go there, request room 309. That was ours. Not bad at all.

reviews.author: Dejuan Feil
reviews.content: Was expecting hotel to be poor if not terrible after reading reviews on trip advisor. Was not prepared for what we discovered. Nobody even heard of the hotel, bugs in the rooms, rooms not cleaned, leaking toilet, very noisy etc and the receptionist advised us we were getting the best room in the hotel. A joke ! Don`t know how they are even allowes keep this place opened. Awful !!!! We spent very little time in the hotel but still would not dream of reccomending it what so ever. Worst hotel I have ever come accross !!!!!!!!!!!! Don`t book it !!!

reviews.author: Rosemary Hessel
reviews.content: Our recent stay to this hotel was like going camping. Someone else booked this room for us. First of all we got there in the evening. We were not sure at first if we were in the right place because when the cab driver dropped us off we thought we were walking through the back door of a restaurant. We checked in took the elevator, which only held 3 small people to our room. The hall itself was so narrow two people had to take turns walking down them. Our room had no air on upon arrival, had to open the window to plug in the AC. In the room we had to take turns walking around because it was so small. We found smashed roaches on the wall, no soap, toilet lid, shampoo, no place to put toiletries in bathroom, had to ask for towels, looks to be like they had water leaks down the walls, had a dressing table but could not use it because the stool was between the table & bed and you could not pull out the stool. Make sure if you book here that your clothes are pressed unless you like ironing out in the hallway on attached to wall iron & board. NIGHTMARE!

reviews.author: Jesse Kessler
reviews.content: This hotel was the worst hotel I ever stayed in. The room was dull and cramped. The sheets were dirty and the walls stained. The staff entered our room while we were out shopping and moved us to another room. The packed our belongings in bags and moved us from two to one claiming there was a plumming problem but I demanded to see our old room to discover it was already let to new people. We had to call the police to sort the problem out he said it was a bad hotel and we should not have been there. Then on our last night I was confronted by a huge mouse in the lobby!!! The hotel manager was abusive and hung up the phone when we complained. Don't stay here. Lisa

title: Swansea

description: Hurst Dene is located in the leafy suburb of Uplands just off Uplands Square on the main road to the heart of the Gower peninsula. They offer guest rooms and self-catering apartments at affordable prices.
name: Hurst Dene Guest House

reviews.author: Celestine Keeling
reviews.content: We used Hotels to find a newyorkcity hotel. when we arrived it was like a bowery flop house! I had my children with me and we had to get two rooms and they werent even next to each other. There were broken bottles in the hall and pubic hairs in the bed. this was the broadwaymanhattan hotel. we were going to see a show and wanted to walk in the theater district. I couldnt stay there with my family, so we had to get another room at the hilton, which cost us 400. for the night, plus the 200 that was non refundable from the other place! We contacted Hotels that we booked through and they took no responsibility and wouldnt even discuss what we had found at this hotel that gets 2 stars on their site! Beware of the catchy Hotels commercials, we learned the hard way.

reviews.author: Mrs. Yolanda Emmerich
reviews.content: I would not stay here even if they pay me. The WORST hotel at which I've ever stayed. It's 10 times worse than what you can possibly imagine of a bad hotel. It's so very nasty. I couldn't stand it even with my eyes closed.

reviews.author: Mrs. Ellsworth VonRueden
reviews.content: My friend, her parents and I wanted to be able to go to New York and have a good time, but when we all saw this hotel, we knew what a dump it was. Just that the fact that there is a piece of paper taped to the door to tell you that this is a hotel should give you an idea about how bad it really is...No room, screws for sink handles, clogged bathtub drain. The TV didn't work, there was no VCR, you could hear everything that was going on in the rooms around you. The elevator smelled horrible and the curtains didn't even keep out the light. Lastly, there were no dressers, just hangers and hooks, that's it! Yes, the hotel IS located close to times square but is it worth it to stay somewhere that is totally disgusting just to be close to times square?

reviews.author: Ms. Thaddeus McDermott
reviews.content: I took my daughter and three of her friends here for a girls weekend. The room and bathroom were very clean and the staff was very helpful. The only problem (and to five females it was a big one) and surprise was that we saw several cockroaches!! I was very surprised as it all looked very clean. I think the attached restaraunt (a small chinese diner style place) is the culprit here. We all had trouble sleeping because of this, thank god we were only there for two nights and were not in the room except to sleep and shower. Ths day staff was great and we had plenty of heat once we asked for it. I have to say if it weren't for the bugs I would recommend this hotel but I will never go back, I hate bugs!!!!!

reviews.author: Ms. Jackson Stark
reviews.content: stayed for a week, older hotel, but clean rooms and very friendly staff, breakfast included in price and was very good. very good value for the money. staff was very helpful in getting our truck in the parkade, which was a close fit. beds were comfy. will definately be staying here again.

reviews.author: Dr. Hortense Ebert
reviews.content: We stayed at the Quality Inn for one night precruise. Our room was small but clean,and the beds were very comfortable with nice linens. Ice machines are on alternate floors. I would like to recognize Jacob at the front desk for providing excellent service. He gave us directions to the Aquabus to Granville Island,and also arranged a taxi at a specified time for our group to the cruise port. I see from other reviews that there were complaints about the restaurant in the hotel. We did not avail ourselves of the hotel restaurant. We ate dinner that night and breakfast the next morning at the White Spot restaurant,which is one block east of the Quality Inn(see review).

title: Swansea

description: Comfortable hotel just outside Tamworth town centre with Reuben's Restaurant & Bar.  Ideal for business guests with free wifi and easy access to motorway network.  Very family friendly with excellent value packages including entry to Drayton Manor & Thomas Land, Conkers, Twycross Zoo and National Space Centre.
name: Ramada Tamworth

reviews.author: Lera Stoltenberg I
reviews.content: I want to commend Hotel Le Marais on their hospitality, competence, reliability, efficiency and attentiveness regarding our hotel stay. From the beginning of our booking process earlier this year to the final checkout I have been very pleased with all stages and personnel. Shawn was excellent booking my room and giving me the room I requested. He was always cheerful and anxious to help The next day after we checked in, we overslept for breakfast and we came down to the front desk and explained that we have missed breakfast this morning and asked to the young lady who was working if we could get some fruit and yogurt. As fast as she could she ran to the kitchen and brought us oranges, apples, yogurt and amazingly she also included muffins, sausage patties with English muffins, milk and orange juice. Seriouslyâ€¦this is SERVICE!!! The type of service you donâ€™t find everywhere. She went above and beyond our expectations and if I remembered correctly her name was Daphneey. The room was clean and nice, with everything you could possibly need. The bar was awesome with candles lighting up in every table. Shawn and Alex at the bar were amazing. The heated outdoor pool was relaxing. My wife and I were really impressed with the overall appearance of the hotel, the staff and especially the comfort of the beds. Thank you Hotel Le Marais, your immediate staff, the front desk staff, to the housekeeping departmentâ€”each person made my wife and I feel welcomed, cared about and treated like a friend. We will definitely comeback again and again!!!!!

reviews.author: Isai Johns
reviews.content: This hotel is newly renovated. It looks great today. They cut corners in renovation, for example, they didn't replace the elevator which is painfully slow. They used cheap doors and you can hear right through them. While waiting for an elevator we could clearly hear a shower in one room and a whoopie session in another. The complimentary breakfast is lame. A few boxes of cereal and bagels laid out in the bar, not a service person to be seen. That said, the bed was great, free wifi is appreciated,location is great and quiet. The rooms are pretty, small but nice.

reviews.author: Athena Feil
reviews.content: I recently had the pleasure of staying at the newest French Quarter property, Hotel Le Marais. While still undergoing the final touches of a massive renovation, this is a beautiful little gem right off of Bourbon Street. Upon arriving, parking can be a little tricky, as with all of the boutique hotels in the quarter. But valet was great. Lobby was small but very efficient, with the hotel lounge overlooking a stunningly beautiful courtyard, complete with a small pool. The rooms were very nice and stylish,. The beds were incredibly comfortable. LOVED the step in shower. Although no tub, the shower was great! And, even though you are less than a block off of Bourbon street, I couldn't hear any of the noise. This property is a real asset to the French Quarter and I would highly recommend it whether your going to the city for business or pleasure. Can't wait to stay again!!

reviews.author: Georgianna Nitzsche
reviews.content: I would highly recommend this hotel. The room was great, very modern, comfortable bed, and very nice and clean room and bathroom. The restaurant and bar are amazing. They have a few tables with beer taps at the table very cool. The bar is very modern and well stocked, if Abby is your bartender then your in for a treat, she is the best. Great staff and service. I stayed with my uncle and his friend booked the room and he did not know I was coming so when we asked for a room with two beds they had nothing available so they took some $$ of our bill and gave us two money vouchers towards the bar or restaurant. Great location a few blocks from bourbon street so you don't get all the noisy rift raft at night, and walking distance to Jackson square and the Frenchman. If Acme has a line 30 deep which it usually does go across the street to Felix's its better and is where the locals go, huge fresh oysters the best I have ever had. Enjoy the devils play ground I did.

reviews.author: Doyle Trantow
reviews.content: Recently stayed there for a night. It was my first trip to New Orleans, and the staff (especially Helbert) had great recommendations for food and entertainment. They were incredibly nice. Parking was cheapish and on-site, so I just drove right up to the hotel and valet-parked. The room was what you'd expect from a W: stylish, comfortable bed, nice bathroom. There is some construction going on at the hotel, which is sort of annoying, but it was not a problem on my floor. There's a great pool as well.

reviews.author: Princess Reichert
reviews.content: I had a pretty nice stay for three nights at the W under renovation in the French Quarter. Great location, nice staff, service variable, but OK, and I am fussy. Was in a new room. The good news is that unlike most W's there was enough light for my aging eyes. The bad, the new decor is really terrible. Why didnt they keep it simple instead of painting the walls orange with an eyesore of a design as the focal point of the room and the ugliest carpet I have ever seen. Could have been amazing, now certainly comfortable, and the good part is you close your eyes at night and dont have to look up at the scary design above you. I'd stay again, but sorry for the poor designer.

reviews.author: Maia Wehner
reviews.content: Love this place. The construction is a pain, but should be wrapped by summer. The staff was so over the top nice and helpful it made up for any jack hammers. Especially ask for Halbert and Daniel. The two guys were super cool and couldn't be more helpful. Southern hospitality at its finest. Ya'll.

reviews.author: Joannie Effertz MD
reviews.content: The staff at this hotel was the friendliest and most helpful of any hotel we've ever stayed in. Since there is currently construction going on at this W, it is difficult to give a fair rating. As SPG members we expected a better room. The only available room was small and there wasn't even a comfortable chair in it. But at least it was at the rear of the total away from the construction noise and jackhammers. A stay at this W will probably be better after the construction is completed and, hopefully, the rooms are upgraded a bit. The extremely friendly and accommodating staff and great location in the French Quarter are reason enough for us to return to the W on our next visit (after renovations are completed).

reviews.author: Arlie Leannon
reviews.content: We just stayed at the W New Orleans French Quarter. We had a very unfortunate experience with our room being located close to construction taking place in the hotel. The staff at the hotel was extremely attentive and did their very best to make things right for us. I can't say enough about the concierge Halbert. Truly a stand-out in service. Recommend verifying up front if construction is still taking place and if so doing what you can to ensure you are not going to be affected by it. Don't expect a fancy W - this hotel is older and going through remodel - but do expect excellent service. Some of the nicest people we met in NOLA - a place where everyone is friendly and nice.

title: Tamworth (England)

description: A hostel run by the Gatliff Hebridean Hostels Trust in the remote village of Rhenigidale, which is 6 miles from Tarbert on foot, or 13 miles by road. The road has only been there since 1990 and the only way in used to be on foot or by boat. The hostel does not take bookings, and has no phone.
name: Rhenigidale Youth Hostel

reviews.author: Garett Balistreri
reviews.content: We stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel for two nights in February. The hotel was great. The rooms were nicely decorated and the beds were quite comfortable. There was a stocked refrigerator in the room. However, the prices of everything was outrageous. Needless to say, we didn't touch anything in the refrigerator. A bottle of water was $7.00 plus a 20% surcharge and 6.5% tax. The pool was beautiful, it had a nice waterslide. The water wasn't very deep. The deepest part of the pool was 4ft 6in. We stayed at the hotel for the fass passes and early access to Harry Potter. It was definitely worth it. Harry Potter reached maximum capacity by noon and with the fast passes we never had to wait to get on the rides. The location can't be beat if your going to the parks.

reviews.author: Ebony Balistreri
reviews.content: Before booking our trip to Universal Orlando, I read a lot of reviews on TripAdvisor - thanks to those who take the time to post. Some were favorable, others not. With two teenage boys in tow, we opted for the Hard Rock Hotel. Our room was ready when we checked in (around 2pm) - clean and all in order. No problems with housekeeping during our stay. No problems with noise (we had a "garden view" room not facing the pool). Ate at The Kitchen for breakfast each day. A bit pricey but typical for resort restaurants. Food and service were good. Very easy walk to Citywalk and the two parks. Using your room key as Express Pass is the BEST benefit. We did not do the early AM entry to Harry Potter. Too many people do that so the lines wind up being long. During the regular hours we never waiting more than 30 mins. Priority seating at restaurants never was useful. Being able to charge to your room key is handy - especially when teens are on their own and need to purchase food. But watch out for limits as your cards get cut off if you exceed them. You need to work out limits with the front desk. Many restaurants in Citywalk give AAA discount so always ask. We used the Mears Shuttle from the airport. For a family I would not recommend it. Mears puts too many people in a van and makes too many stops. For a few bucks more, opt for the taxi.

reviews.author: Mr. Taurean Schneider
reviews.content: Traveled here Jan 14th for 3 nights. Doubt we will make It to three. So expensive - worse customer service ever. Jonathan at the front desk was helpful, Paul with room service and a handful of others. This has been a nightmare. Room by elevators - listened to dinging of elevator all night. New room reeked of smoke and febreez in the smoke free hotel , not so good for a child with allergies. Jonathan was as genorous as he could be. After getting room service- it took 4 people over thirty minutes to get us a wine tool for the $70 bottle we had ordered. The food was freezing cold once it did arrive. When we called "star service", they repeatedly answered and hung up - or sent it to voicemail. Save your money. I wish I had. I have had better customer service at a gas station. Perhaps hiring the cute young girls is backfiring........

reviews.author: Delbert Conroy
reviews.content: Just got back from a wonderful birthday weekend at the Hard Rock! We had a basic room but were upgraded to one(b-day amenity??) with a great view of the pool , lush landscaping , and the twinkling lights of the Universal rides in the distance. Everyone on staff had a smile and a helpful attitude! We enjoyed food and drinks at the Velvet Bar,breakfast at The Kitchen, and drinks at the pool. The location was perfect to get to the Universal parks and it was a short drive from the airport. I think that families and romantic couples or just a bunch of friends would all have a wonderful stay in this hotel!! I highly recommend it!

reviews.author: Patience Mohr
reviews.content: average hotel don't phone home on the hotel phone. we paid $408 for 6 short phone calls to the uk.

reviews.author: Mr. Ulises Ankunding
reviews.content: We stayed in a Kids Suite at the Hard Rock Hotel for a week this summer, and we loved everything about our stay. The room was perfect for our family of 4. Our girls loved not only having their own room, but not having to share a bed with each other (they each had a twin bed). They also loved the pool slide. While others have complained about noise, we didn't notice any noise. The location cannot be beat - a short 5 minute walk to Universal Studios and CityWalk. And having front of the line passes for Universal was awesome. We can't wait to return!

reviews.author: Emelia Monahan
reviews.content: This was our second trip to the Hard Rock Orlando & if possible it was even better than the first. The hotel itself is stunning, immaculate & contains something for everyone - young & old, the music piping throughout all common areas adds a modern yet unintrusive touch. The staff could not have been more accomadating & friendly, from the bar staff to the cleaners passing in the corridors at all times of the day. Checking in & out was particularly straight forward, as was getting taxis from the front of the hotel. The rooms were cleans, spacious & comfortable. The location in relation to the parks & City Walk along with the free express passes are undoubtable perks to staying here & add to the already incredible holiday experience.

title: Tarbert (Harris)

description: This place offers well-equipped rooms, many with lovely views over the old fishing harbour and across Carmarthen Bay. It's part of a Listed Georgian terrace, built over 175 years ago as individual summer houses. A lift runs from the first half landing and there are footpaths directly to the beach.
name: Fourcroft Hotel

reviews.author: Mrs. Noemy Cummerata
reviews.content: just got back from Pier House. Stayed in Lanai room...the beds were heaven. Loved the beach area, pool was too warm during the day but great at night and open 24H. Location was great walked everywhere. Took the new CityView Trolley and Fury for catamaran ride. Loved walking the boardwalk along the ocean. Great stay at the Peir House and would stay there always the beach was such a plus ! Went to South Beach to watch the great 4th of July Fireworks too

reviews.author: Mathilde Marks
reviews.content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 3 nights, which was way too short. The hotel was perfect! extremely clean and well maintained, great food, a beautiful beach (which was a pleasant surprise being i was prepared for the "lack of great beaches on key west" as I was told) but it gave me my "fix" when i wanted to lay out. Ironically we found we only layed on our beach for 2 hours during the entire 3 days as we explored all the streets of key west. there's so much to see and so much to do. I owe a great thanks to all the wonderful people on tripadvisor, as the suggestions on things to do and see was spot on. We loved our bartender Brian who sadly is moving back home. he helped us a lot. I highly recommend renting the bicycles...it's a good way to explore the town and burn off the calories from the wine the night before! few key points: great small clean beach and clean beautiful water hotel provides computer to check-in online and print boarding pass service was EXTREMELY nice always greeting you hotel was VERY clean... location is PERFECT..steps from mallory square/sunset festival/ (Roof top cafe is great to eat at) VERY QUIET despite being on top of Duval street. I AM A LIGHT SLEEPER and I swear they must have installed sound proof glass! Enjoy all key west has to offer .....I underestimated how much fun it would be

reviews.author: Dr. Titus Boehm
reviews.content: I would not recommend the room with the spiral staircase to the bedroom upstairs. The staff were friendly. The food was good. I would reccommend eating at Blue Heaven and having the Lobster Benedict. It was nice to look at all the boats going by. The location is where its at! Walk to everything! The cost of this hotel should be in question though. The pool is cold, and there isn't a beach. The deck is small. Safe and nice all in all.

title: Tenby

description: Comfortable family run hotel with spectacular views and superb food produced from best local produce.
directions: On the waterfront near the distillery
name: The Tobermory Hotel

reviews.author: Trisha Roberts DDS
reviews.content: I've read other reviews where people seem unhappy with this resort. I found it perfect. I called 10 days before my arrival and got the exact room I'd hoped to get. I was upstairs on the corner. I had two windows, one faced the pool the other faced the river. I was in Oak Manor near the bridge that is closest to the main facility. One night on the way back from Magic Kingdom we had just missed the bus to the Riverside resort, so we decided to take the bus to French Quarter and walk the path over. We weren't halfway there when a security guy picked us up in his golf cart and dropped us at the bridge that goes straight to our building. This trip was during the holiday season and the resort was decorated beautifully. I would definitely stay at this resort again. I highly recommend it to families. The food court was great. The prices were high, but you expect that at Disney. Although we did order a pizza at the food court to take back to the room and it only cost about 15.00. And that fed us all. We flew so we were sort of at the mercy of Disney prices as we didn't have a car to go off property. I would definitely recommend having a car if at all possible. We had a fridge in the room so if I'd had a car I could have gone to Walmart for lunch meat. But whatever, it was fun. The hotel was great. Again, I would recommend this resort.

reviews.author: Mary Conroy
reviews.content: There are two types of themed residential areas in this resort. The â€œAlligator bayou.â€� area has smaller accommodation blocks and an informal feel and atmosphere. The other region (called Magnolia Bend) is an impressive and formal deep south, old grand mansion, look and feel area. There is a (0.9 mile) walkway / cycle path which forms a loop around and across the Sassagoula river which runs through the center of the resort. The pathway has a link to through to the French Quarter resort. The path affords great views of the resort as you wander, jog or cycle around it. Depending on which accommodation you get you may get very familiar with the walkway as you trail back and forward to the food court. Aside from the theming the rooms are identical. The Alligator bayou rooms have (fake) log bed frames which are really easy to stub your toes on. (yep I speak from experience there.) The rooms are slightly bigger than an All Star Resort room and have a refrigerator and coffee making facilities. Other than that they are the same basic layout with the door at the front and the bathroom (with no window) at the rear. The room can be a little dark if the lights are switched off. (Why would you be in the room during the day anyway?) The air conditioning is a through the wall unit rather than a central type and it can be a bit noisy if you leave it on. (Itâ€™s Florida, you will probably leave it on.) There are some good swimming pools with the relaxed â€œOlâ€™ Man Islandâ€� pool having a water slide. All Pools at Disney are heated so you can swim all year round. Food court. The resorts reception, bars shop and restaurants are located in the â€œSassagoula Steamboat Companyâ€� building. There is service restaurant (Boatwrightâ€™s) and a general dining area (Riverside Mill) with a reasonable choice of food. Both are nicely themed. There is also a bar which serves snack food in the main building and a bar poolside on Olâ€™ Man Island. The shop has a limited choice of essential items and the usual large choice of Disney items. This is a nice calm and relaxed resort. It is a more grown up resort than All Star for not excessively more money. The grounds and general ambiance is superb and this makes the resort feel like it is a higher standard than the moderate grade it is afforded. I would not recommend this as a first choice for families with young children as it isnâ€™t quite as â€œDisneyfiedâ€� as other resorts. If you want a similar standard that is a little more kid entertaining go next door to French Quarter.

reviews.author: Lenny Mills
reviews.content: This is the second time that we have stayed at Riverside and were not disappointed. This time we stayed in the Alligator Bayou rooms-which are exellant, and have a rustic feel; I liked these better than the Mansion rooms. The beds were very comfortable. The food court has many choices, one of my favorite is the Mickey waffle with strawberries. The gift shop is also great! One feature that keeps us coming to Port Orleans is their boat service to Downtown Disney. This is such a relaxing ride, and much better than taking the bus. It is also a short walk over to French Quarter. On evening we walked over to French Quarter and had a drink at their lounge (highly recommended is the Tropical Ginger Lemonade [I think that is the name]) and relaxed while looking at the Christmas decorations. The only bad part about the building our room was in is that there was no elevator in that building (some buildings have them and some don't). Overall I was very happy with our stay and highly recommend both Riverside and French Quarter.

title: Tobermory (Scotland)

description: Is a traditional riverside log cabin in the heart of tranquil Troutbeck.
name: Kingfisher Lodge

reviews.author: Vidal Altenwerth
reviews.content: This is a beautiful hotel in a great location, just blocks from the Barri Gotíc, with easy access to Metro and RENFE train stops. The private terrace is a great, usually quiet place to enjoy your goodies from La Boquería. Our balcony room was nice, but the balcony wasn't large enough to sit out on (though we could see chairs on the larger balconies for other rooms). Triple shutters helped to keep most of the street noise out. On the downside, the Wi-Fi was very flaky, especially in the room, less so on the terrace. The bathroom had a bit of a mildewy odor and the staff, though polite and professional, wasn't as warm and helpful as you might hope. Also, as others have observed, there are no in-room fridges or mini-bars. Overall, a nice place to stay, but if you're looking for more personal service or more amenities, you may want to look elsewhere.

reviews.author: Roberto Ortiz
reviews.content: The hotel is a 3 star hotel on a lovely street which is not too busy but has all the bars, restaurants etc you want, and is 2 mins from the Plaza Catalunya (with metro, local train connections, etc). It is in a lovely converted house with a beautiful stairwell, but the view from mine and I guess most rooms is very limited. The room is also small but very well fitted out, and modern. Despite the internet being down for my 1st evening it is probably my favourite (of 4) hotels in Barcelona - but if you want to shower without washing your hair, go elsewhere. For some reason the shower head is directly above the (well fitted out) cubicle and maybe 2.75 metres up (old building = high ceilings) so showering is like being in hot rain.

reviews.author: Jeff Dietrich
reviews.content: We booked the Praktik Rambla because of all the great reviews here, and were really looking forward to staying here. I thought this was a decent hotel, but I don’t think it lives up to all the raving reviews. The location of the hotel was quite perfect. It is just north of the most touristy area of Barcelona, which makes it very convenient but also not as chaotic/messy as the area south of it. It is also a block away from a metro interchange station (with multiple lines) and three blocks form a Rodalies station on the R2 line (i.e. frequent and direct trains to airport and Sitges, two of our destinations). One of our key criteria was to be close to the gay bars/clubs (so we can drag our tired a**es home in the middle of the night/early in the morning without too much hassle) and this hotel was perfect for that. Being close to the gay area also means that there are tons of nice/trendy restaurants nearby that less touristy. The front desk staff were friendly, knowledgeable and helpful. Though since it is a small boutique hotel it usually only has one staff member at the front desk. This means if there is a chatty client (or someone who did not do their travel research) in front of you, you might be waiting for a long while. The housekeeping staff can be a bit more attentive (the bathroom counter was dusty when we got there; we ran out of shower gel and were not given more for two days), but nothing too major to complain about. We stayed in standard double rooms. There were two legs to our trip so we stayed in two different rooms that were very similar. While I appreciate that the hotel boosts that “less is luxe”, the rooms are too minimalistic in my view (and I am someone who usually appreciate chic and simple). There are certain basic functional features that are missing, such as a desk, a chair, an alarm clock, a small fridge, a closet, an ice bucket, etc. The rooms were trendy and well decorated, but they were really small (even without the aforementioned furniture).

title: Windermere

description: This is a hotel and event venue offering over 400 bedrooms and 75 event suites. It originated as a family home from the 14th century, and is made up of several buildings - including an old school house and an iconic white mansion – featuring ornate architecture like grand white exterior pillars, barrel-vaulted ceilings and stained glass windows.
name: Beaumont Estate

reviews.author: Mrs. Maureen Hand
reviews.content: This hotel could not have been better located for our first trip to Barcelona. It's in the smart and stylish Eixample district, just moments from all the beautiful modernista buildings. A short stroll in the opposite direction plunges you into the Old Town; walk right through it to the sea front. Everything we needed was on the doorstep - excellent cafes, tapas bars and restaurants. On the couple of occasions we wanted to go a little further afield the hotel staff were very knowledgeable about the best way to get there using the excellent metro and bus systems. The reception at the hotel is staffed by young people with excellent English who are unfailingly helpful and friendly - great ambassadors for this beautiful city. Don't bother buying the breakfast voucher though. Better and cheaper to put together your own breakfasts at the tapas bar next door.

title: Windsor and Eton

description: This 87 rooms hotel of the Four Pillars chain is on the outskirts of town, just off the A40/A415 roundabout. It offers modern 4 star rooms and a good on-site spa and pool.
name: Oxford Witney Hotel

reviews.author: Mina Barrows
reviews.content: My room was so small I began to feel uncomfortable, the "infinity" pool was nothing more than a Koi fish pond and faced buildings with no sight of the ocean and extremely windy, a very empty feeling to be out on that Lanai with employees jumping at the chance to make a quick buck! The spa was nothing more than 4 rooms with no amenities, no ladies or gents locker facilities, nothing but a few showers and a dangerous large bath tub, the service at the spa over the telephone was ridiculous, I felt like I was bothering them asking simple questions. Because I am an avid spa-goer I decided to visit the spa to have a face to face conversation as their prices are very high for a simple treatment. I got the same attitude just in person. Both the gentleman and lady were abrupt and discourteous, I did not book any spa treatments thank goodness, that spa was nothing more than a few rooms thrown together, total joke for a "Trump inspired spa". I dined in their restaurant and after finishing my mediocre and over priced meal overheard the waiter complaining of the amount of tip I had left to his colleagues! I checked out the next morning and moved to the Royal Hawaiian Hotel where first class service is always given, This is a joke of a hotel, the amenities are a bore, the gym is again facing buildings and with no life, the entire property is a cold experience, it actually gave me the creeps. The service from start to end was horrific, there was so much pretension, no ALOHA as they used that word every step I took. As a world traveler and an avid hotelier I would not recommend this property to anyone and will never step foot there again, take your vacation to a true destination not some want-to-be hotel where everyone that worked there was miserable, fake, quick to take your money, NO ALOHA, Trump International Hotel is Waikiki is a major thumbs down, if you want a real escape The Royal Hawaiian Hotel is where its at!

reviews.author: Morgan Gibson
reviews.content: Everything was impeccably clean. The staff are friendly and address you by name which was nice. The bathroom is roomy with plenty of towels, although the water pressure is on the weak side. The bed was very comfortable, the flat-screen TV was large, and the free wireless Internet was really appreciated. The hotel is a short walk from the beach, and I mean a very short walk. You just cross the street from the hotel and the beach is like 50 ft. away through some green space. I was on the beach everyday and the proximity was a big surprise because looking on a map, it seemed a lot further. Also nearby are the shops and malls, and also plenty of restaurants to choose from. For a first time visit to Hawaii, it did not take much effort to find what I needed. I tried the spa and found it pricey for the experience that I got. I was there during the marathon weekend and the staff made the effort to make sure all guests were aware of the traffic issues and to help you get to the airport through the traffic mess. I would definitely recommend this hotel, and would stay here again.

reviews.author: Ms. Lyric Hirthe
reviews.content: I'm just back after over 3 weeks in the Adagio. The studio was fine, very modern, clean, the space was well used. It was sufficient for 1 maybe 2 people max. There were few maintenance issues, and everybody seemed to experiance some issues with internet conection. Once you arrive you should ask for a cable but you will only be able to use the internet at the desk. When it works its good, when it doesnt, it doesnt and i usually abandoned my computer for few hours. There is wifi in the lobby. I had some issues with cleaning. Sometimes i would be left with 4 towels, sometimes just two, sometimes there would be no bin bags in the bin. the electricity card would be taken out and laptop would go out of charge. Small things. The self service washing machine costs 6eur, you get a tablet/powder for it. Dryer is 3 Eur. It works on time so this buys you two hour use of each.The bed is big and comfy but the pillows are square and not great. I must admit the staff seems a bit not interested and wont go out of their way or anything but they are not rude. Over all despite the small issues described above I would recomend the hotel even for a long stay. Ps. there is a little Italian restaurant near hotel called Pizza Factory and its quite cheap but nice.

reviews.author: Pascale Effertz
reviews.content: This modern "business" hotel actually offers a lot to the vacation traveller as well. It is very well positioned just one block back from the K'Damm, the iconic shopping and entertainment street of Berlin, and only 10 minutes walk from the lively Savignyplatz restaurant and shopping area, and the Savignyplatz train staion giving easy access to the rest of Berlin. My room had a small well-equipped kitchenette, which, with two supermarkets a block away, made preparing odd meals very easy. However there are plenty of restaurants nearby if you don't want to cook. The front desk staff were extremely helpful with little problems such as the cable TV not receiving English channels - quickly fixed. Free Wi-fi in the ground floor area actually made for quite a convivial atmosphere as people brought their computers and iPhones down to the lounge area.

reviews.author: Zaria Harber
reviews.content: Location was just five minutes walk from the popular Ku'Damm with it's shops and U-Bahn stations. The buses to and from the airport also run along the Ku'Damm, even in the middle of the night if you have an early flight. Hotel room was spotless and had stylish decor with lots of storage and a comfy bed. I particularly liked having a safe within the room. This hotel is an "Apart Hotel" so rooms have a kitchenette. This was very useful meaning you could make your own breakfast and snacks if you liked. Our slight issue was that workmen are currently renovating a building next door and made noise quite early in the morning but on the positive it gets you up to make the most of your stay so it didn't spoil things! Besides, there is an incredible amount of building work going on in Berlin anyway so I expect many hotels have a crane next door to them so I'm not going to mark the hotel down for that as it's beyond their control. I would definitely stay here again.

reviews.author: Tyrese Prohaska
reviews.content: Very good place to stay in Berlin- just what I was looking for! Comfortable and professional service, I will certainly stay again in this hotel.

reviews.author: Jules O'Kon
reviews.content: The staff were very friendly and all welcoming and most helpful when sorting out issue with one of our travel agency (quite rude one). They were very responsive to any requests we had and left us with a very warm feeling. This hotel is nicely located to access Berlin's attractions and also restaurant. Rooms were clean and very clean, which then gave us excellent sleep, and also there is the bar and restaurant which provided the very good service. Will come back !

reviews.author: Zaria Blick
reviews.content: One of the best hotel i have ever stayed. Hotel located 10-15 walking distance from San Marko square in a very quate place. I stayed in Junior Suite with the canal view. It was unforgatable. Large room with antuque style and furneture.We have 5 oclock tea with the cake in nice room with the red furnuture. the breakfast was very variety even with the champagne. If you are looking for lovly and romantic place for a good memories Paruta hotel is the best ever!!!

reviews.author: Jana DuBuque MD
reviews.content: My daughter and I spent 3 nights in Venice for my Birthday at Palazzo Paruta, what a fantastic experience, the staff were wonderful, the location could not have been better, Venice was spectacular!!! The room albeit small (standard room) was spotless we did look at the suites whilst in the hotel and they were just to die for!!! Huge and the furnishings wonderful well worth paying the extra, however saying that our standard room was excellent value for money. The breakfast exemplary cereals, croissants, crepe's to your taste, scrambled eggs bacon & sausage, all types of cake, yoghurts, bread rolls and bread for toast a selection of cold meats and cheeses, what a selection. We will definately return and would advise anyone to visit Venice and stay at Palazzo Paruta.

title: Witney

description: Due in part to the presence of a large consulting company in Woking, a large corporate Holiday Inn is located in the centre of the town.  It's expensive but more comfortable than your average Holiday Inn.  Expect cheaper rates at weekends.
name: Holiday Inn Woking

reviews.author: Dion Stracke
reviews.content: Stayed 5 nights right on the edge of the Barri Gotic near the harbour. Staff were very helpful. The rooms were large, extremely clean and imaginative in design. As we only booked last minute room only we didn't sample the restaurant or breakfast. There are plenty of places nearby to eat which I prefer to try rather than stick to the same hotel restaurant every morning.

title: Woking

description: A former chapel and schoolroom. Sleeps 3.
name: Ty Capel

reviews.author: Donna Kassulke
reviews.content: We stayed for 3 nights. Prior to arriving I had applied for several types of standby upgrades, including the Business Plan upgrade. I discovered on arrival that I got the Business Plan upgrade. I received a letter from the front desk clerk informing me of what this included (internet, local and long distance phone calls, one breakfast daily, a bottle of water, etc). Boy was I glad I saved that letter. The staff at this hotel simply don't know what they offer. One of the days we went to breakfast. I had to argue with the hostess that I was 100% positive that one breakfast was indeed included on my room rate. And upon checkout I was told that long distance calls were not covered. I pulled out the letter to show the desk clerk that indeed they were covered. She quickly changed it and said that they had just changed what the business plan offered. Fair enough but then management needs to be better about communicating to staff about what is included in the rates. I don't want to have to go to the front desk to check out and get a corrected bill. I would rather have checked out online in my room. But this wasn't an option as the included charges had to be removed from the bill after the fact. Very annoying. Another annoying thing were the bellboys trying to hijack our luggage constantly. One bellman came over to my husband and TOOK his suitcase despite his protestations that he could manage it himself. It seems like they are simply desperate for tips. Or that's how it comes across to me. The location is good. The rooms were ok. But I wouldn't rate it high for cleanliness - I noticed an M&M on the carpet and it was still there the next day. Same for the gum wrapper that was near the chair. Bed slept ok though. All in all, I wouldn't say that it was a particularly good value for the money. And the management needs to get the staff to be more competent and knowledgeable.

reviews.author: Mike Kemmer
reviews.content: Stayed at the Hyatt Regency Boston after getting it thru priceline for $90.00 per night. We really only have 2 complaints. 1) The walls are paper thin. You can hear EVERYTHING going on in the rooms next to you...and I mean EVERYTHING!!! 2) the pillows seemed very hard. I took one out of the pillow case and found it was hard because it was jammed into this very skinny case that was about 12 inches wide. I guess they were going for looks, not function! The location was very good for what we were in town for. We wanted to stroll around a bit and visit Quincey Mkt. It was very east to get to the hotel from the Mass Pike too!

title: Betws y Coed

description: The oldest of the three properties, a 17th-century single-storey white-painted cottage. Sleeps 2.
name: Ty Uchaf

reviews.author: Lyda Langworth
reviews.content: Just returned from a short jaunt to Boston. We had two rooms located on the 10th floor. The set up of the hotel is odd, but nice. The valet parking ($43) is ridiculous and much more than other hotels located only blocks away. Rooms were nice but very tired looking, exception given to the beds which were extremely comfortable. The furniture and the bathroom are showing their age. Most noticeable was the carpet. This is not, of course,. something to ruin a stay, but noticeable in what's known as a 4 star hotel. Views were great as was the location of the hotel; walking distance to most spots or a quick jaunt on the T. Pool was okay. Small, but fine for a city hotel. Definitely about half the size of the photos. Service was okay. I jokingly asked the woman in "gift shop" what the markup on the gatorade was (@ $4/bottle) and she was extemely vicious in her reply. I truly was just kidding but she apparently didn't think it was funny. We were given connecting king rooms which obviously doesn't work with 2 adults and four children. This took quite some time to get resolved and the front desk person was not too helpful. The concierge was always helpful and gave us pretty good recommendations. The biggest plus is the location. Comparing the hotel to other Hyatt properties, the Boston prpoerty doesn't come close. They really do need to refresh the rooms.

reviews.author: Twila Sauer
reviews.content: We flew to Boston for the weekend just for relaxation and to see the historical sights. We arrived at the Hyatt by taxi from the airport. The Doorman was extremely friendly and wanted to help us right away. The front desk checked us in very quickly and we went up to the 19th floor to our room. Our room was comfortable and cozy. We had a wonderful view of the city of Boston. The king bed was outstanding and probably the most comfortable bed that I have ever slept in. The decor of the room looked new and modern. There was a small chair in the room that I used a lot to read my Boston maps in. It was very comfortable for the size of that chair. We used the concierge several times while we were in Boston to find restaurants and trolley stops and tours. The concierge told us about a restaurant called "Kennedys." We ate at the restaurant and we loved the food and the service was great! My husband used the workout room about 4 times while we were there and he said it was the best one that he had seen in any hotel. One thing that we found convenient while we were at the Hyatt was that you could enter Macy's store and walk through it to get to our hotel. It was 26 degrees outside and we were thrilled to be able to stay inside instead of braving the cold wind. My husband had left his gloves at home so he bought a pair at that Macy's. All of the people working at the Hyatt went out of their way to be helpful and friendly! Our floor was very quiet and we never heard any noises outside our door in the hallway. This hotel was a real joy to stay in and I would love to stay there again on our next visit. One last thing, we loved the fact that Christmas carols were playing all of the time by the elevators which put us in a festive mood. Thank you for that!!

reviews.author: Carey Runolfsson
reviews.content: We were in town for the Parents Weekend at Berklee. The hotel lobby is not great, but the location is good (near Boston Commons and the start of the Freedom Trail). The concierge was very helpful. The pool and workout area are very good for a hotel. I found the pool temp great, but I used it for swimming laps. We had a drink in the bar each night after returning from dinner. Not a very exciting lobby bar, but lots of good places closeby. The room was clean, bed too soft for my taste. All in all, I would stay here again.

reviews.author: Dr. Kristopher Kub
reviews.content: Very nice Hyatt. Great location - close to Commons, T, museums and historical sites. Used points for the room. The room was comfortable but with 2 kids it got a little crowded. We spent most of the time sightseeing. The pool and workout facilities were excellent.

reviews.author: Dakota Wisozk
reviews.content: If you can get a deal on Priceline, then this is a great hotel to stay in. It's not a 4-star hotel by any means, but the fitness center and pool are top notch. Rooms are clean, service is nice and the entire place smells like gardenia (which got to be disconcerting after 3 days). Here's the biggest complaint - the elevators. You have to take two different elevators to get to your room. There's the one that gets you to the lobby, then the one that takes you to the rooms. When it's dinner time and everyone's trying to make their reservations in time, it's quite annoying trying to escape the hotel!

reviews.author: Kirsten Fadel
reviews.content: It was the conference hotel, so I stayed there. The layout of the function rooms and lobby and elevators was confusing -- it was hard to find my way around the hotel. The restaurant in the hotel was expensive and a little iffy. We had to send seafood back because it was spoiled. There were weird lags in service in the restaurant. But there are plenty of restaurants in Boston; there's no need to eat at theirs. Wifi is $10/day. Beds and room were comfortable; bathroom was nice; everything was clean and well-organized; personnel were pleasant. Overall decor is soothing and stylish.

reviews.author: Shawna Pfannerstill
reviews.content: This hotel was great. The location is great for the theatre district and downtown crossing. It's very centrally located for touring the rest of Boston as well. Very convenient to the T (trains) at Downtown Crossing and Park Street. It's a little bit dated in the elevators and public spaces, but the rooms are very nice, recently updated. One annoyance is that there is no outside entrance into the lobby of the hotel. From the street level, you have to take one set of elevators to the lobby, then cross the lobby and take another set of elevators to the room. The elevators are slow, so this can be annoying if you just want to get back to the room quickly. The staff was very friendly and helpful. They even gave us early check-in on Friday at noon, and a late checkout on Sunday (2pm) which is much later than most hotels allow. The bed was great...one of the more comfortable I've slept in. My only complaint is that housekeeping didn't refill the coffee supplies for us, which isn't much to complain about. Also...a parking tip. Parking at the hotel is very expensive. Post Office Square, nearby, has a weekend special, check the prices here: http://www.posquare.com/

reviews.author: Piper Konopelski
reviews.content: My husband and I were looking for a quick, one-night stay in Boston. Priceline provided a great price for the Hyatt Regency, one block from the Boston Common. We had an above-average experience,at a great price for the location. The block that the hotel is on isn't terribly picturesque, situated at the end of Downtown Crossing, but it's within walking distance of most major spots -- including the theater district, Back Bay, Boston Common and the Public Gardens. Front desk staff was courteous, check in was easy. Our room was small but looked as though it had been recently upgraded, and was attractively furnished. King bed was incredibly comfortable. Anthony, the concierge, was helpful and friendly. There are certainly more luxurious accomodations in Boston, but probably none more attractively priced in such a central location. I'd definitely stay there again.

reviews.author: Brielle Bayer
reviews.content: We were able to get this hotel for only $99 through hotwire, so needless to say that this hotel was worth every penny. We stayed one night during the wine festival, and though it wasn't close to the Trade Center, it was only a short taxi ride away. The Hyatt looks like it may be an older hotel from the outside, but the rooms are totally updated with a modern touch to them. There was a nice atrium when we arrived on our floor, which gave the hotel a comfortable feel to it. The staff was friendly, and the location is wonderful (just a block from Boston Common area). The room is a fair size, with a very comfortable bed and very clean. The bathroom is average size, but very well appointed to. One downfall was the lack of a hotel safe. I haven't been to a "4" star hotel lately that did not include a safe. But other than that, we had an excellent stay at this hotel, especially because of the price we booked it at.

title: Betws y Coed

description: A family run hotel and restaurant in a former mill building, with pleasant view over the Aire river valley and Bingley town.
name: Five Rise Locks Hotel and Restaurant

reviews.author: Kendrick Bradtke
reviews.content: Nice hotel. We had great service from the valet parking and front desk. Room was clean and everything in order. Good breakfast in the AM. Overall a good experience.

title: Bingley

description: 6 bed hostel, open Apr-Sept.
name: Soerneog View Hostel

reviews.author: Clementina Abernathy
reviews.content: My husband surprised me with a 5 day trip to Puerto Rico. The choice of the Intercontinental-San Juan was the best. The location is just 2 miles from the airport. Our room, which we upgraded to Ambassador level, put us oceanfront which had a magnificent view & included a sofabed & large club chair. The bathroom was a little small, but the extra vanity by the closet was helpful. The staff at the pool & beach area were very helpful. For travelers with children there are nearby chain restaurants: Chili's, Burger King, Ponderosa. A large grocery store 3 blocks was great to buy snacks & bottled water, cheese & crackers, yogurt, which we could keep in the fridge in our room. The taxi service in Puerto Rico is quick & clean. There is a public transportation stop just outside the hotel for sight-seeing such as Old SanJuan for $.75, but allow about 40 minutes each way. The best part of the trip was the ocean & pool areas & having our 4 p.m. pina coladas under our umbrella ($10. daily rental). Go & enjoy this great spot.

reviews.author: Reed Gleichner
reviews.content: Booked 4 nights at the IC Hotel in January using priority club points. The stay was the absolute WORST IC hotel experience ever. I am a Royal Ambassador and was treated terrible by hotel management from check in to checkout. Hotel staff, especially Guest Relations and Front Desk Manager, was extremely rude when I questioned them on upgrading to a better (Platinum Royal Ambassador. Was told 3 different stories why I could not get upgraded to the Club floor or junior suite (standard practices at all other IC Hotels for Platinum Royal Ambassador Members). In addition to my experience with hotel management, the common hallways were very dirty and stayed that way for 2 of the 4 days. Rooms are very small and noisy. Would not recommend this hotel at all. I did not use hotel restaurants or bars in protest of check in experience. I do however recommend the restaurant and lounges at the El San Juan Hotel next door to IC which are extremely nice. Did use the IC spa and was cheated out of 15 minutes of paid spa time. When I complained to Spa manager her English went away. Relayed story to Front Desk Manager, who said he would look into the problem but never did. The last 2 years I have stayed on average 90 nights at priority club properties all over the world. This stay alone has encouraged me to seek out a new hotel group that treats all guest staying at their property (paid and reward nights) the same. If I am treated this way as a platinum royal ambassador, I canâ€™t image how other guest would be treated. Hotel appears to be more interested in entertaining the local population with their small casino than hotel guests.

reviews.author: Kristopher Crona
reviews.content: My partner & I stayed here for 5 nights in early February after spending 3 nights at El Convento in Old San Juan (see separate review for that). Although I had done my research and expected the Intercontinental to be nice, the hotel really blew us away and exceeded our expectations in almost every way. First off, we got a great deal that included a free night and full breakfast every day. The breakfast buffet costs $25 per person so this was a great thing to have included. On top of that, we were upgraded for free to on ocean view room on the 7th floor when we checked in (we had booked and payed for a pool/garden view). Service was outstanding everywhere, from the door men to the car rental desk. The property is gorgeous and they are on a very nice, but busy, piece of beach. Like all of San Juan, drinks & food are expensive here. Although we didnâ€™t eat dinner at the hotel, we did have cocktails and lunches quite often at the beach bar restaurant. The hotel even has a wine bar which was very nice as well. As several other reviewers have mentioned, Isla Verde is not the place to stay if youâ€™re looking to visit OSJ which is why we split our 8 night trip between 2 different places. We rented a car one day and drove to El Yunque and a visit to Luquillo Beach. Although there was a lot of traffic, it was nice to be on our own schedule and it was also less expensive than going on an organized tour. Make sure to visit Nestor, the concierge, who was so helpful arranging or recommending anything. We did the spa one day and the facilities were very nice. There are several great restaurants close by; we actually ate better here than we did in OSJ which, again, surprised me. The best dinner we had our entire trip was at Pamelaâ€™s in Ocean Park, about a 15 minute drive from the hotel. Cheâ€™s, an Argentinean steak house, was also awesome and about a 5-10 drive or cab ride from the hotel. Within walking distance is Metropol for really great Cuban food. For the most part, we enjoyed the sun & sand here and basically relaxed in style which is exactly what we wanted. Highly recommended.

reviews.author: Riley Kunze
reviews.content: Interesting as always to separate fact and fiction from the reviews on the site. Facts. The safe was locked when I got in the room and may have been broken, but I did not care and nothing was stolen. The pool is not heated, but it was over eighty and the water felt good after laying in the sun. There is seaweed in the ocean and last I checked that happens in the ocean. If you wade out about ten feet it was clear. The rooms are not huge but they are not small ala a w hotel. The staff was great, very friendly and helpful. The breakfast staff was exceptional at the buffet. Food at the pool and hotel was reasonable for a resort. Not cheap but not bahama expensive either. They do charge the resort fee as they indicated on the site when booking so no surprise there. Overall great hotel resort, easily walkover to el San Juan to see the crowds. As for improvements. New beach chairs would be nice as would fresh paint on the balconies and better reception on the television. Still all told my kids wanted to plan on going back next year.

reviews.author: Kattie Deckow
reviews.content: We stayed at this hotel two days before a cruise and one night afterwards. The rooms were very spacious and had two queen sized comfortable beds. The staff were attentive and most friendly and willing to assist. The breakfast was fantastic, with a vast choice of everything you could wish for. The chef who does the eggs and omletts sings and dances as he cooks, he was my favourite. The hotel is in close proximity to the airport and there are many restaurants and shops in walking distance. The beach is clean and not at all crowded, there are some stalls but no one hastles you to buy. The gym is open 24 hours which is handy when you body is adjusting to the time difference. I loved Puerto Rico and plan to come back for a longer period of thime.

reviews.author: Emory Abshire
reviews.content: After the initial surprise and worry of how close to the airport the hotel is, we were very pleased with this hotel. The room was nicely sized, and although our 7th floor ocean front faced a tree, we could see ocean to the right and left of the tree. It also looked over some ugly rooftops of buildings, and the balcony had only room to stand. Other than that, the hotel was just great. The pool was wonderfully large, with one bar in the pool and one on the ocean. The restaurants inside the hotel were rather expensive, but there are plenty of choices around the hotel. Take a couple of trips into Old San Juan, one in the day and one at night. At first we didn't think we would enjoy another trip to San Juan, but after a week, those thoughts were quickly banished.

reviews.author: Maeve Herzog
reviews.content: Extremely courteous and helpful staff. Very clean. Beautiful pool. Beach is about the softest sand I've ever encountered. I enjoyed the casino, although it's a tad small and the roulette and craps tables were closed. There are restaurants within walking distance, but tons of places within a short cab ride.

reviews.author: Reyes Zemlak
reviews.content: I have stayed here man times before and Im always satisfied, however my only concern was that they have become alittle lax in security...I noticed people from outside able to walk into the pool area through the beach..I didnt feel as safe as I used too. The staff is friendly, but I noticed not many around. I had to walk to the bar to get a drink. The pool rea and the beach are very nice...the pool should be cleaned every day and its not. The rooms are excellent. I always get an oceanview, because its so beautiful looking out into the water

title: Rathlin Island

description: 38-bed YHA hostel; meals available.
name: Crowden Youth Hostel

reviews.author: Clovis Kertzmann
reviews.content: This is what I expect from a Hilton (not that I always get it). Really appreciated the Front Desk staff helping me with my late night, last minute request. Room overlooking the beach was beautiful and great to sleep to the crashing waves. Casino looked entertaining - even though we didn't partake.

title: Crowden-in-Longdendale

description: Broad Street. Contemporary 3 star hotel offering 285 stylish rooms, free WiFi and complimentary breakfast.
name: Hampton by Hilton Birmingham Broad Street

reviews.author: Mireya Williamson
reviews.content: I am a travel agent and I have stayed in my fair share of hotels around the world. The Hotel Burnham is my new favorite. I had the pleasure to stay in a Executive suite with an amazing view of the Chicago Theatre and Macys and from the other side Millennium Park. The room was large for a boutique hotel with a separate living area. Bed was extremely comfortable. Everything from the Atwood Cafe, to the elevators to the opulent hotel lobby features the charm that Chicago is all about. Another huge bonus is the location of the Burnham. You are literally a stones throw from the Lake subway on the red line, another block to the blue line. You can get to either O'hare or Midway airport with ease using public transit if you wish. With the location and decor aside, the main part of this hotel that sets it apart is the service. Whatever we needed at the Hotel Burnham, we got. The front desk was sincere and helpful. The housekeeping staff left personal notes and did an excellent job cleaning up our suite. Everything from check in to check out had a personal touch that you just can't get at a Radisson or major hotel chain. My boyfriend and I both really enjoyed the nightly wine receptions. This hotel exceeds any experience I've had at a city hotel, you won't be disappointed.

reviews.author: Brando Willms III
reviews.content: Who would have thought you could have such a comfortable hotel right downtown Chicago that was so quiet. The staff is friendly, and very accommodating. Plus you're steps away from all of Chicago's greatest spots and staying in an important historic landmark. The decor in the rooms is a little too frou-frou for my tastes, but not overly obnoxious.

reviews.author: Kasey Hessel
reviews.content: Spent two nights at this lovely hotel and loved it. The hotel is well located in the centre of Chicago right on the shopping streets. We walked everywhere and didn't miss having a car. Our room was big with a huge bed (although apparently we only had a standard room). Beautiful clean bathroom which was kept immaculate during our stay by housekeeping. Loved the touch of the zebra or leopard print dressing gowns!! We had a room overlooking the street but we were high enough not to be kept awake by the road noise. The staff were excellent - friendly and helpful but all very efficient. We did not eat in the restaurant but it did look nice but we had no food included in our room price. One piece of advice - join as a Kimpton In Touch member and you get free Wifi and $10 to spend on the mini bar. Excellent touches like free coffee to take away in the morning and free wine reception in the evening for all guests.

reviews.author: Angelica Hudson
reviews.content: My wife and I arrived on a Sunday morning at 9:00 am on Aug 21st. We did not expect any rooms to be available since most of Chicago was booked for the weekend. We checked out bags in a holding room til the afternoon. We eventually made it back to the hotel around 3:00. The check in was lightning quick. We stayed in the historic section on 12 th floor in room 1205. We had great view of State and Washington and everywhere else. We had a deluxe queen comfortable bed , nice couch, desk, closet, mini bar, and flat screen. The showers had the best water pressure that I can ever remember. Aveda bath products if you're imto that sort of thing. I'm used to Hampton inn generic myself. The Burnham had a restaurant near the lobby that I wish we would have visited instead of Quartino Italian up the road. The folks working the front desk were friendly and very helpful. The location was good, right next to the blue and red line stations. If i return to Chicago, I will most certainly reserve a room here again. I recommend the Hotel Burnham, an Incubus concert at Northerly pavillion, and Bobby's bike tours.

reviews.author: Mrs. Cassidy Nicolas
reviews.content: This hotel is very nice and clean. Excellent location to shopping/restaurants/Park/theatre - all within walking distance. Lots of freebies: Starbucks coffee and tea in the lobby beginning at 6:00 AM. Wine served at 5:00. Always fresh water in the lobby. Staff is very friendly and accomodating. Room deco is great, bed comfy and normal size bathroom! I was very pleased with the stay and will definately stay there again.

reviews.author: Carson Labadie
reviews.content: My family of four spent my birthday in The Burnham in mid june. It was great. Martin, the front desk manager is a charming man who was kind enough to get my wife and me a corner room which allowed us to look up Washington to see the top of the Gehry pavilion in Millenium Park and down the truly great street, State Street, to see the Chicago theatre. We were directly kitty corner across the street from what was the flagship Marshall Field's store, sadly, now Macy's. It was a short 2 block walk to visit Millenium park and an easy walk a few more blocks to the Art Institute. Or, we could have turned left and walked the magnificent mile. The room was lovely and met all of our needs. We had breakfast in the bustling ground floor restaurant and it too was excellent. They also set out coffee for those who just want to grab a free cup of joe on your way out the door. Kimpton properties are uniformly well run and exude a "fun" vibe. This may be their very best property. The physical plant and the staff are excellent. My kids room was small, only 175 square feet but they use every inch and it did not feel crowded. I highly recommend this hotel.

reviews.author: Alessandra Mitchell
reviews.content: I have never had to write a bad review based on service for any establishment, so this review should really come across as strong regarding service at the Burnham Hotel in Chicago. My issue revolves around making reservations for international guests and I was to book 6 rooms for two days (being a good customer). I never received any confirmations as promised and after the second day, I called and was transferred 4 times, cut off, and received a recorded prompt to leave a voice message. In a professional and courteous manner, I did just that. Four hours later, no call back from the hotel. I then called back on three occasions and it seems like everyone is a manager when you ask for one. Another important aspect of this is was the fact that I was booking direct through the hotel and not via a third party which can cause conflicts. I am shocked frankly. A four star hotel messes up reservations placed on a credit card twice. Then to top everything, when I went to book the rooms, the special group rate of $118.50 per room jumps to $190 and the arrogant representative on the line states, that is the best I can do. Luckily, I went to another hotel a block away, received rates for $90 for a better upscale hotel, and received an email confirmation within minutes. I am not sure why this happened and who is inept at the Burnham Chicago (A Kimpton Hotel), but never again will I stay at this chain. Brian

title: Birmingham (England)

description: Where comfort meets great value rates, all guests receive free WiFi in public areas and a complimentary breakfast to set you up for your day.
name: Holiday Inn Express Birmingham Oldbury

reviews.author: Orval Rippin
reviews.content: My 2 teenage daughters and I wanted a short weekend away and i was lucky enough to take advantage of a TravelZoo promotion at the Hotel Burnham in Chicago. From the welcoming e-mail we received a couple of days ahead of arrival right to the loading of the car at departure we were treated like royalty. The luxurious rooms,the restored wood and iron grills on the elevator were even appreciated by my daughters which from teenagers is a real compliment. The offer of a glass of wine when I first entered the lobby after stressing through rush hour traffic was very welcome. I know there have been lots of complaints about noise but we had a corner room on the 12th floor and we had no problems with noise. Even though we were across from the elevator we never heard anyone in the hallway-it was as if we had the place to ourselves. We had an amazing deal for the 2 nights but I'm already making plans to go back with my husband this time and I would happily pay the going rate if there are no discounts available. The hotel is central to everything and we enjoyed walking in all directions to see what was around the corners. My first trip to Chicago but I'll be going back for sure.

reviews.author: Furman Carroll
reviews.content: Spent three nights here before moving to another hotel for a conference. Should have stayed here for the duration. Beautiful, quite hotel in a historic building with an unparalleled location. Staff were uniformly friendly and helpful--all seemed happy to be working here. This will definitely be my Chicago hotel for future trips.

reviews.author: Clementina Luettgen I
reviews.content: We have a corporate rate with this hotel and I can't be happier. It's an ideal location to our office (3 blocks away) and it's got great decor. Everything feels like its brand new yet looks antique. The huge windows afford a great look of the area outside and checking in and checking out is extremely easy and painless. The staff here is always trying to make my stay better than the previous one, which is great. Checking in at most other hotels is about as exciting as going to a bank and you get treated like a chore. There is construction going on across the street at a 24-hour pace. Surprisingly, it has yet to disturb me or disrupt my sleep.

reviews.author: Lillie Roberts
reviews.content: The Hotel Burnham is a recommended experience for anyone exhausted of the bland environment of many major chain hotels. First of all, the ambience is quite nice, where the up-to-date interior design exploits the charm of the historic architecture with quite a modern flare. My wife and I stayed in the smallest room available (queen bed), overlooking State Street, but found the space large enough for my needs. The room was very clean, comfortable, and visually pleasing. The view of the Christmas Tree and Macy's made it all the more romantic and quaint. The staff was quite professional and friendly. Overall, it was top-notch service and a great experience. I am now addicted to Kimpton hotels and will stay there as often as possible in my travels. Now most reviews are not found credible without some constructive criticism. While I have very little serious criticism of the hotel, I found the food selections, and in particular, the wine, at their restaurant slightly overpriced considering the competition of world-class dining in the area. However, the food and service was still, by-and-large, above average. Considering many respected hotels have much worse food quality but at inflated prices, this hotel's dining is definitely ahead of the game. Overall, a more more memorable hotel stay. Hotel Burnham is luxury at a very reasonable price.

title: Birmingham (England)

description: The tall tower with 224 rooms has relatively large common areas and everything expected of a Holiday Inn Express, including free WiFi and breakfast included in the room price. It replaces the older property which now became the ibis Styles.
name: Holiday Inn Express Birmingham-Snow Hill

reviews.author: Magdalen Kilback
reviews.content: There's not much more to say about the Hotel Burnham, but we love it just like the rest of the reviewers here. I think it's a great value for the location and everything else about the hotel. Service was great. The only downside was rooms don't have coffeemakers....however, when I asked one was sent to our room immediately. Restaurant was great for dinner and breakfast. This has become "our" hotel in Chicago. Oh, you can't beat location on blue line of subway, which takes you right to OHare.

reviews.author: Florine Blick
reviews.content: Great boutique hotel - we've stayed here before several times and loved it. HOWEVER, they're building across the street, which isn't the big problem, although a bit noisy. The big problem is the city of Chicago is doing street repair in the middle of the night. We were there the weekend of April 20, 2007 and at midnight the jack-hammers were still pounding. When I managed to fall asleep, at 1:30 am, I was woken by the noise again. It went on all night. Since we were staying the weekend - management moved us to another Kimpton hotel, but what a hassle. Again - great hotel, but wait before you go. We heard from one hotel employee this has been going on for a while and is going to continue...for a year! Go only if you can sleep through anything.

reviews.author: Rene Halvorson
reviews.content: We spent a night here while in the area visiting family over Christmas, and had our dog with us. The Kimpton group, which owns this hotel, was always pet friendly when we had stayed at their other properties, and were just as much so here. Our dog is a 55 lb Shepherd mix, not a little lap dog, and that didn't phase them either. If you aren't into travelling with your pets, however, this place is still a gem. And as an aside, I didn't see anyone else there with their pets during our stay, so I would doubt the place is overrun with them for people who don't like animals. They also had us on a pet-friendly floor - so presumably you could also make sure you were on a floor without animals if you had allergies or something. The pet friendly rooms did not smell wierd or have anything wrong with them, they seemed just like all their other rooms - just, presumably, away from people who didn't want to be by animals! The location is fantastic - you could walk to all the great downtown spots from here, and you are smack in the middle of the theatre district. The rooms are small - but have very high ceilings and practically floor to ceiling windows, so they feel much larger than they are. Nicely decorated, that is the Kimpton hotel "thing" - all their properties are funky, boutique, edgy but always comfortable. Great bed at the Burnham, which I have luckily also had when staying at other properties of theirs. We didn't eat at the restaurant because we had other plans for our meals while there, but it was always full of people and the menu looked appealing. Staff was very friendly, even when our dog woofed at those wearing hats (she's a Shepherd mix, what else can I say?) and helpful (with directions and similar). We paid $152 + tax and valet parking - and again I think this is one of the best values for the money in downtown Chicago. We have stayed at a number of downtown hotels over the years - and (with or without our dog), this is definitely a hotel we would come back to next time.

reviews.author: Philip Becker
reviews.content: Was booked into this hotel as others were full and was pleasantly surprised. Have been told this was an old speakeasy and retains some of its charm, though it is hidden away behind an unassuming front. Antique elevators add some character to the hotel. Staff was attentive and generally very good. Room was very small for the price, but perhaps expected for Chicago. Location also great in bustlng area -- across from Marshall Fields, and a few blocks from tourist area on Michigan Avenue. A bit pricey, but met expectations for a hotel of this price range.

title: Birmingham (England)
